boardgame.name: A Brief History of Ability Checks in Dungeons & Dragons
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Situations arise in roleplaying games where the rules don't exist to deal with the actions a player attempts, or they don't uniquely determine the results of these actions. Ability checks arose as one solution to this problem. This booklet summarizes a dozen of the different Ability check systems that have been developed for Dungeons & Dragons over the last forty years.

boardgame.name: The RPG Dictionary
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Every RPG System listed from 1975 to December 2003

User summary:

An alphabetical enumeration of extant RPGs, including edition notes, author credits, and brief comments.

boardgame.name: Clash of Armies: Medieval – Hitos
boardgame.description:
8-card Milestones expansion for Clash of Armies: Medieval.


We have terrains to fight, we have weather that condition our battles. And now we have milestones. With Hitos, at the moment of achieving these milestones, you will have a benefit that will last you the rest of the battle.

boardgame.name: Doughgeon
boardgame.description: A single image dungeon for the 2022 24 hour dungeon contest.

boardgame.name: Típico de Machirulo!
boardgame.description:
A game to identify scenes of micromachismo. Whoever identifies them the fastest wins!

Típico de Machirulo! is a speed game where players have to find combinations of cards to win. In these cards are hidden figures that represent different scenes of micromachismo in our daily lives.

It also comes with an ideal pedagogical proposal to work on the subject in schools.

boardgame.name: Guardians: Dagger Isle (Western Expansion)
boardgame.description:
Expansion for Guardians (FPG): 123 new cards.
Adds new creatures, spells, items, shields and terrains to the game.
Also adds the Freebooter's Stronghold with 3 upgrades cards and 2 new Vierkuns, Grahzue and P'Tal.

boardgame.name: Cabbage Patch Kids: Touching Tunes
boardgame.description:
Everybody knows the Cabbage Patch Kids! Ever since they were discovered by a little boy named Xavier, they've been making friends wherever they go. Touching Tunes unique electronic game board is filled with musical fun--all at the touch of a finger.

There are 6 fun-filled Cabbage Patch Kids games in all. Some specially designed for the younger player, others for the more advanced. And each one invites players to use elementary skills such as counting, matching, and memory.

1. Side-By-Side - In this game, it takes two cards to make a Cabbage Patch Kid complete. Match the most cards side-by-side and you're the winner!

2. Look Alikes - Here, there are lots of Cabbage Patch Kids! Be the player to match the most cards by the number of 'Kids or the colours of their outfits.

3. Family Five - You'll have an entire family when you collect all 5 Cabbage Patch Kids--each one with a different hair colour.

4. Make-A-Face Race - Be the first player to win all the right cards that make a friendly Cabbage Patch Kids' face complete and you're the winner.

5. The More, The Merrier - In this game, just like in the Cabbage Patch, 'Kids are growing from cabbages. Be the player to "pick" the most 'Kids from the Patch and you're the winner.

6. Heads Up! - Blonde hair, brown hair, black hair, red hair - even no hair at all! They're all here. And it's up to you to win the most pairs of Cabbage Patch Kids by matching their hair colours.

boardgame.name: Warp's Edge: Anomaly
boardgame.description:
Far from home. Deep in hostile territory. Your starfighter’s overclocked warp drive is now creating anomalies, little tears in the fabric of spacetime that alter situations and require you to adapt on the fly. Can you use these anomalies to your advantage? Trust your instincts. The citizens of the Outer Rim are counting on you.

ANOMALY is an expansion for WARP’S EDGE, a solo bag-building game of space combat. New starfighters, motherships, and skills add to the options alongside the anomalies, an all-new token type.

FIGHT. WARP. REPEAT.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Warp's Edge: Anomaly – Token Upgrade Pack

boardgame.name: Warp's Edge: Anomaly – Token Upgrade Pack
boardgame.description: Acrylic tokens to replace the tokens from the expansion (six power tokens, twelve anomaly tokens and nine time tokens).

boardgame.name: Mind MGMT: Secret Missions
boardgame.description:
Throughout the components of the MIND MGMT game, there are 9 hidden codes. When you enter these codes into the website FluxSafeHouse.com, they give you a brand new card that you can print out and add to your game. This Secret Mission expansion provides all 9 of the hidden cards, professionally printed.

Each card will come sealed in an envelope so you can choose to either open them all up, or search for the hidden codes yourself. When you find a code and enter it into the website, you will be instructed to open a specific envelope.

boardgame.name: Battle of Chefs
boardgame.description:
Preparing a recipe has never been so difficult! Gathering ingredients won't be enough, you'll have to be the smartest and trick other players using all kinds of utensils. Everything is fair in this funny battle of chefs!

Each turn, each player will draw the utensil, recipe or ingredient cards that most interest them. They can then complete up to 3 recipes at the same time and annoy other players with the utensil cards.

You will have to complete the recipes with the necessary ingredient cards without being spoiled by other chefs.

The game ends when a player is the first to reach 8 recipe points.

boardgame.name: I'm Right, You're Wrong: Game-Breaker Expansion Pack
boardgame.description: Game-Breaker is an expansion pack for I'm Right You're Wrong. It contains 6 mind bending cards that transcend reality and literally BREAK the game. Come back from the dead and completely flip things on your opponents.

boardgame.name: I'm Right You're Wrong: NSFW
boardgame.description:
This is the Not Safe For Work Version of 'I'm Right You're Wrong'

---

I'm Right You're Wrong is a fun-first game that promotes mental wellness, themed around petty arguments. In fact, it was inspired by a real life office spat.

Outwit and outlast your opponent(s), by holding onto your hand, and not breaking a rule.

Take turns, drawing a card and playing one from your hand. Each card is empowered with consequences. Some cards reduce your hand, some cards restrict your options. The twist is… attacking opponents screws you over, not them. It’s the only card game where playing your least worst option is your best. Play is similar to other casual games (hand management, elimination, take-that). No actual role-play or arguing involved.

—description from the designer
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: I'm Right You're Wrong: Shots Fired

boardgame.name: Zoot!
boardgame.description:
If you enjoy Scrabble or Wordle .. Zoot! is here to make your word-nerdy dreams come true!

Object : To obtain the highest number of points by combining the 7 cards in your hand into a single word. Re-arrange your cards until they come close to forming a word. Start your turn by drawing either the face-up card or the one at the top of the draw pile. Then discard one of your other cards to end your turn.

The first person to form a word and yell Zoot! wins the round, and adds 10 points to their score. Their opponent then has one more chance to make a 7-letter word. They pick up one additional card from either draw pile and add a wild card to their hand for a total of 9 cards. Game continues until all cards in the deck have been played, usually 4-5 rounds - and the highest final score is the winner.

boardgame.name: Moderner Seekrieg: Neues Marine-Schach
boardgame.description:
Whole title - "Moderner Seekrieg. Neues Marine-Schach" (eng. "Modern naval warfare. New naval chess") is a board game, like chess for 2 players (blue vs red).

Each player controls 18 playing pieces - different warships.
Game play: At the beginning, the game figures are placed in specific squares on the game board (always the same as specified in the instructions). As in the chess, the different figures/ships moves on the game board in different ways and are removed when the square is occupied by another player.

The object of the game is to capture the opponent's Admiral ship (like a king).

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Pax Stellarum
boardgame.description:
Pax Stellarum is a spaceship Tabletop Miniature gaming ruleset designed to be able to represent ships from any Sci-Fi universe.

Players are not limited to just designing ships, but can also develop their own fighters, weapons and troops. This allows players to design different forces for each race they play with, thus better representing the diversity found in Sci-Fi universes.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Troll Cave (Remastered)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Monstrous Lair #02: Troll Cave provides you—the busy, time-crunched GM—with the details to effortlessly bring to life the troll caves in your campaign.

Are you a busy GM? Does session prep take too long? Do you never have time to work on the cool little details that can bring your adventures, dungeons and campaign to life? This short, focused compilation gives you, the time-crunched GM, the tools to effortlessly add verisimilitude and detail to your dungeons. Use the material herein either before or during play and bask in your players' adulation.

boardgame.name: Ogre Cave (Remastered)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Monstrous Lair #3: Ogre Cave provides you—the busy, time-crunched—with the details to effortlessly bring to life the ogre caves in your campaign. Are you a busy GM? Does session prep take too long? Do you never have time to work on the cool little details that can bring your adventures, dungeons and campaign to life? This short, focused compilation gives you, the time-crunched GM, the tools to effortlessly add verisimilitude and detail to your dungeons. Use the material herein either before or during play and bask in your players' adulation.

boardgame.name: Cthulhu Wars: The Eidolon miniature/card
boardgame.description:
Initially part of Onslaught 3 Kickstarter, the miniature is also available independently with rules on the publisher website.

How to Obtain the The Eidolon Loyalty Card: Pay 2 Doom to take this Loyalty Card. Then place the Eidolon anywhere on the Map.

Powers:
Hierarchy (Ongoing): The Eidolon generates 1 Power during the Gather Power Phase. He can be Captured like any Cultist and is Recruited, rather than Summoned. He cannot Create or

Control Gates.
Eldritch Wisdom (Ongoing): If the Eidolon is in play, after any player's Action you can force each player to write down his or her next Action and then flip this Loyalty Card face-down. Example: an enemy who plans to Move must write "Move" but he need not say which Units are Moving, nor to where. On each player's next Action, they must perform that Action unless it is now impossible to do so. In this case another Action may be taken. Flip this Loyalty Card faceup in the next Doom Phase.

boardgame.name: Making Changes
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In a land of constant change, the realm has become stuck. Your job is to get it changing again.

Things are a changin’ Part 2 of 2

A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 2 Characters. Optimized for APL 8.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: Why Aren't We Changing?
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In a land of constant change, part of the realm has become stuck. You are tasked with finding out what froze the land in its current state.

Things are a changin’ Part 1 of 2

A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 2 Characters. Optimized for APL 8.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: Revenge of the Rakshasa
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

HAPPY LUNAR NEW YEAR - THE YEAR OF THE TIGER. 2022.

Journey to Samsara, the Feywild's Domain of Delight, a realm of Rewards, Reincarnation and Fortune.

Inspired by The Myths of the Lunar New Year and the Animals of the Eastern Zodiac.

A mystical desert saga in the Domain of Delight, Samsara.

An archfey of Samsara, The Maharani has decreed that any suitor that completes the challenges and retrieves the treasure hidden in the Golden Desert of Samsara will win her beloved daughters’ service and a pact with the archfey herself. However forces in the shadows await for opportunities to strike.

The Feywild: The Domain of Delight, Samsara.

An adventure for adventurers to reach the magical feywild. The Domain of Delight, Samsara is unique in that it is ruled by thirteen powerful Archfey that share this domain. These Archfey are known as the Zodiac XIII. Explore the Golden Desert, and The Golden lands of the Jewel Oasis and Golden Temple.

Adventurers will have opportunity to meet one of the archfeys of Samsara, The Maharani.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: Udder Chaos, The Holy Cowspiracy
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Journey to Samsara, the Feywild's Domain of Delight, a realm of Rewards, Reincarnation and Fortune.

Inspired by The Myths of the Lunar New Year and the Animals of the Eastern Zodiac.

Journey to the Domain of Delight, Samsara and explore the mystery of the Honey Milk Village.

The denizens of Samsara have lost contact with the village of Honey Milk, adventurers are hired to solve the conspiracy, and find the missing archfey of Samsara.

A sinister mystery and delve into the undeground labyrinth in the Feywild.

The Feywild: The Domain of Delight, Samsara.
An adventure for adventurers to reach the magical feywild. The Domain of Delight, Samsara is unique in that it is ruled by thirteen powerful Archfey that share this domain. These Archfey are known as the Zodiac XIII.

Adventurers will have opportunity to meet one of the archfeys of Samsara, The Herder.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: Vampire Survivors
boardgame.description:
Mow thousands of night creatures and survive until dawn! Vampire Survivors is a gothic horror casual game with rogue-lite elements, where your choices can allow you to quickly snowball against the hundreds of monsters that get thrown at you.

Source: [Steam page].

boardgame.name: Dungeon Fighter (Deuxième édition)
Dungeon Fighter (Second Edition)
Dungeon Fighter (Seconda Edizione)
Dungeon Fighter (Zweite edition)
Dungeon Fighter. Második kiadás
boardgame.description:
Dungeon Fighter is back with a brand new Second Edition, 10 years after its original release!

The essence of the game is always the same: the good old cooperative gameplay experience with its crazy dice throws has been improved with streamlined rules, new boards, new dice, new heroes, new weapons, new monsters, and more!

Be a Professional Hero! Explore the Dungeon, face weird and ferocious Monsters, and fight your way to the final Boss! To defeat those fiends, you will need to use all of your focus and dexterity and throw the dice at the right spots of the main target-board. But that’s not all! You’ll also have to deal with weapons, monster abilities and room obstacles increasing the difficulty of your task—but also your rewards!

New Dungeon mechanism
Say goodbye to pre-fixed maps! You will look at two Dungeon cards each round and choose one to determine your next destination!

Risk-it-all last strike rewards
Meet certain criteria to obtain extra rewards at the end of the fight!

Levelling Up Heroes
Your Heroes can now level up their special abilities! Fight better, fight harder!

Are you up to the challenge? Are you a Real Hero? It’s time to prove it! Get a good night of sleep, do your stretches, delve into that Dungeon, and get the job done!
boardgame.boardgameintegration: Dungeon Fighter in the Castle of Frightening Frosts
Dungeon Fighter in the Catacombs of Gloomy Ghosts
Dungeon Fighter in the Chambers of Malevolent Magma
Dungeon Fighter in the Labyrinth of Sinister Storms
Dungeon Fighter in the Castle of Frightening Frosts
Dungeon Fighter in the Catacombs of Gloomy Ghosts
Dungeon Fighter in the Chambers of Malevolent Magma
Dungeon Fighter in the Labyrinth of Sinister Storms

listing.notes:
Brand new copy of the game, in shrink wrap.
Shipping to EU would be 20 euro and the package should arrive in 7-10 days. Elsewhere – please ask!
Check out my other products for sale as well! If you buy multiple items, I will combine shipping costs. It’s much cheaper this way.
Title: Dungeon Fighter in the Labyrinth of Sinister Storms Publisher: Horrible Guild Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Factions of Sol
boardgame.description:
In Factions of Sol, humanity launched an early space-age in 1927, spearheaded by Mark Megacore, CEO of MegaCore Inc. In the years following, factions grew their power in various regions of the solar system, establishing a tense but stable status quo–until Mark Megacore announced his retirement. Now, the mega-billionaire’s entire fortune is at stake, and everyone in Sol is racing to earn it. You will take command of one of these 8 factions and do your best to bring them to victory. The path you choose is up to you–and could lead to unimaginable riches.

But like all things, accomplishing your mission is easier said than done. To impress Megacore, your ship must travel from planet to planet by spending energy onto the board. But moving into a sector costs energy equal to the amount already in the sector, plus one. Because the energy cost is exponential, the board locks down fast. And your ship can only recharge on one planet: Mercury. So while you may need to travel all the way to Neptune, you also need to make sure you can make it back.

Each player only gets one movement and action per turn. Actions include using Mars to upgrade your ship, obtaining explorers at Venus, picking up secret objectives at Saturn, and more. But many actions cost resources, which can only be mined from asteroids. Each round, a limited amount of asteroids are placed on the board. Getting to them before your competitors is key. When a player can’t take a movement or an action, they must pass. When all players pass, the board is cleared of energy and the race to planets and resources begins again.

At the end of the third round, the game ends and you total up your victory points from machine upgrades, explored exoplanets, secret objectives, and resources. Knowing this, you may want to come up with a plan and stick to it. But just when you think you have your strategy figured out, a number of things might stand in your way– or help you cross the finish line.

Gameplay highights.

-Stellar events: Each round, players can vote between two game-changing options, each of which break the game in a new way. Make sure your favored event is chosen, or you may be left behind when it takes effect.
-Orbiting planets: Throughout the game, the planets will orbit, mimicking the actual movement of planets in our solar system. Players can use them to perform well-planned slingshot maneuvers.
-Faction abilities and machines: Each faction has a special ability and machine that changes the way they interact with the game. When used well, your faction ability and machine can give you a much-needed boost.

boardgame.name: Lost for Words: A Game of Untranslatable Feelings
boardgame.description:
Lost for Words has over 300 unique words from over 60 different languages, aiming to broaden our vocabularies, as well as our emotional awareness.

There are Word cards and Action cards:
Word cards have a unique word, along with its definition and source language, and one of seven symbols on the top: heart, lightning, cloud, star, sun, moon, or diamond.
Action cards have special instructions that affect gameplay and strategy.

At the start of each game, each player is dealt seven random cards from the deck, which they keep secret from other players.

On each turn, players have three options:

Play a word card. Place it face-up in front of you, and share how you've experienced that feeling or experience: a moment or memory, who it reminds you of, or how you hope to experience it in the future.
Play an action card. Follow the rules on the card, which ends your turn.
Discard and draw again. Place any of your cards in the discard pile and draw a new card from the deck.

When any player runs out of cards in their hand, draw seven new cards from the deck. The first player to play cards with each of the seven symbols or five of the same symbol is the winner!

boardgame.name: Guardians: Drifter's Nexus (Even More Western Expansion)
boardgame.description:
Expansion for Guardians (FPG).
Adds new creatures, spells, items, shields and terrains to the game.
Also adds the Drifter's Nexus Stronghold with 3 upgrades and 2 downgrade cards and 2 new Vierkuns, Sikura and Vek-Nadra.

boardgame.name: Guardians: Necropolis Park (the So Far Western It's Eastern Expansion)
boardgame.description:
Expansion for Guardians (FPG).
Adds new creatures, spells, items, shields and terrains to the game.
Also adds the Necropolis Park Stronghold with 2 upgrades & 1 downgrade cards and 2 new Vierkuns, Eisnmir and K'Hutek.

boardgame.name: All for One GM Screen
boardgame.description:
Publisher Burlb:
All the All For One vital information at your fingertips!

A selection of tables and important game information for players and GM's alike to fit your Customizable GM Screen

boardgame.name: Get That Pirate's Booty
boardgame.description:
Get That Pirate's Booty is a game of theft, trickery, and sabotage + some pirate ships!

Be the first player to collect 3 sets of 4 treasures or collect all four pirates ships to win.

Battle other pirates for their Booty using challenge cards or use action cards to sabotage other players strategies. Players draw and discard cards to collect sets of cards or steal them from other players using challenge cards.

boardgame.name: Spanish Civil War Commander
boardgame.description:
"Spanish Civil War Commander" is a deep-strategy educational board-wargame system covering the "Spanish Civil War" in extensive detail. We show the high complexity of running a war through simple and engaging game play. Includes land, sea and air operational units.

Intermediate level multilayered game: military operations, industry, agriculture, foreign relations, bank credit,
Easy to play, hard to master.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Unlimited Brunch
boardgame.description:
You and your tablemates arrive at brunch and have "two hours" to eat and drink as much as you want. Unfortunately, sh*t happens. You all must work cooperatively to ensure brunch was worth it for all Brunchers.

Unlimited Brunch is a cooperative card game for 2-8 players, with an available solo mode. Each player selects a unique Bruncher to play as, with each Bruncher having a special ability.

Over the course of "two hours" from "11am - 1pm" or 8 rounds, all Brunchers will order items (food, alcohol, hydration), may share those items with their fellow Brunchers, resolve event cards, and try to avoid vomiting from consuming too much! To win, all players must end the end of round 8 (1pm) in the green ideal zones in both food and alcohol as noted on each Bruncher card.

listing.notes: Complete first edition tabletop card game that includes 16 Brunchers (players), over 20 unique event cards, time trackers, and more!

boardgame.name: Escape Simulator
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb

First-person puzzler you can play solo or in an online co-op (best with 2-3 players, but playable with more). Explore a set of highly interactive escape rooms. Move furniture, pick up and examine everything, smash pots and break locks! Supports community rooms through the level editor.

boardgame.name: The Tripods
boardgame.description:
User Summary

The Tripods is based on the TV shown on BBC where the player has to go to the White Mountains in South-East France.

boardgame.name: Archived
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

You have been here at the library longer than anyone else.
You have seen countless patrons browse the stacks,
each searching for something, whether they know it or not.

Sometimes their search leads them to you.

Sometimes you are taken down, consulted, and are
momentarily allowed to contribute to the world.

Then it is time again to wait.

ARCHIVED is a solo journaling game where you tell the story of a book, map, or other article found in the library. The story unfolds as patrons engage with you, use you for their own ends, and eventually return you to your shelf to wait. Over the course of time you will change not only physically but also how you feel and identify. At the end of the game, you will look back on your past. What will you see when that time comes?

boardgame.name: Kazuni
boardgame.description:
Kazuni is a board game that brings all the strategy of building and maintaining supply chains to life in a way that is fun and refreshing.

Players begin by building factories that are used to produce supply crates for a starving city. These crates are delivered as player explore a dynamic, mystery board and purchase the transportation needed to move those crates.

Players are faced with economic challenges while also handling the randomness of an Opportunity Deck that furthers their chains or inhibits their opponents.

Players collect their income for the turn, then take two actions which can be map exploration, supply chain construction, and/or drawing a card from the deck. After performing their actions, any supply crates that currently exist within a player's supply chain will move according to their capacity. After cargo crates have moved along the supply line, players end their turn by building additional supply crates at any and all factories the player has constructed.

Once a player has successfully delivered 25 crates from their factories to the center tile (City tile) they win the game!

boardgame.name: As Soft as You Remember
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

This game is a short love letter to selkie tales, and to the very human experiences they often mirror and reflect. Use a piece of soft clothing to represent the seal skin you have recently rediscovered, and hold it as you use cards and prompts to reflect on your time on land and your imminent departure. Play solo as the selkie, or connect with a friend to play the partnered roles of the selkie considering their return and the sea welcoming them home.

boardgame.name: Athanor
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Athanor is a solo journalling game about setting sail on a great voyage and leaving your old life behind. Over the course of one year, you will face five trials, and overcome each of them as you change and grow.

The game features:

Flame-based gameplay
Death-defying coin flips
Reflective journaling
11 pages of nautical prose
No, really, you have to use fire to play, that wasn't a joke

The game can be played in the span of two hours, or even less time, depending on how you decide to work through the prompts.

boardgame.name: Hastur Rising
boardgame.description:
Initially launched on Kickstarter.

A sculpture of Hastur and the King in Yellow as well and rules to use the miniature in Cthulhu Wars, Planet Apocalypse, and Hyperspace.

listing.notes:
Cthulhu Wars Hastur Rising Both art prints included and unopened.
Shipping Worldwide: €55 Europe: €40

boardgame.name: Moodboard
boardgame.description:
The aim of the game is to receive as many like points as possible.

In each round of the game one of the players becomes The Client. The Client gives a brief valid for all the "Agencies" (the other players), and then puts on the table a set of random "Visual Cards" each one showing a picture.

Once the brief is established, each Agency has to propose a creative and effective moodboard, able to capture the fascination (and therefore the likes) of The Client, using some of the Visual Cards taken from the table .

A game lasts as many rounds as there are players (each player plays the role of the client once).

At the end of the game, each player adds up the number of likes received and whoever has the most likes wins the game.

boardgame.name: Athenæum Adrift
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

For generations, you have been hailed as a grand repository of knowledge. Scholars, academics, historians, and more have traveled the world over to study within you.

Time passes. You experience the world through the lives of your Curators and the tomes they add to your collections. You grow, learn, share. Shrink, decay, crumble.

Forgotten.

Adrift.

Is your knowledge lost?

Athenæum Adrift is a solo journaling roleplaying game based on the Lost & Found SRD. In it, you play a sentient library as it passes through the ages.

boardgame.name: Five Deadly Venoms
boardgame.description:
Five Deadly Venoms is a 3-player 18-card game that plays in 15-25 minutes. Each round, one player will face off against the other 2, attempting to earn coins by winning precisely the number of hands that they bid. The first player to win 7 coins, wins the game.

The name and theme come from a classic (1978) martial arts movie by the same name. It featured 5 evenly-matched deadly assassins whose techniques were based on venomous creatures. No one assassin could beat another but by teaming up, two might beat one.

The special features of the game are:

Every hand pits one player against the other two.
The deck is comprised of one wild card (the Student), and 17 cards split among 5 suits with a carefully-crafted uneven distribution of card values among the suits.
Hands are resolved by comparing the two cards played by the lone player against two cards played (one each) by the other two players.


The game is presented as a free print-and-play. The rules reference a bid token, but it is optional. The bid token is a disc with a numeral "3" on one side and a "4" on the other. It indicates who bid and how many hands they bid. The rules also mention 21 tokens/coins. These are used for tracking the score. Use any tokens you prefer or keep track of the score with paper and pencil.

I recommend keeping a copy of the card distribution (the last page of the rulebook) out in front of players. It helps players keep track of the unconventional distribution of the cards among the suits.

I really hope you enjoy the game. It's small and quick, but it has some depth in the play. If you're familiar with Euchre, it's a bit like a 3-player version in which one player always goes alone.

It's a nice filler for when you're waiting for other players to arrive.

boardgame.name: Beloved
boardgame.description:
from itch.io:

You were loved.

You are loved.

You have always been loved.

BELOVED is a role-playing game rooted in the Lost & Found SRD. Drawing inspiration from sources such as Toy Story, The Velveteen Rabbit, Small Soldiers and Among the Sleep, you are cast in the role of one of six Beloved - childhood toys acting as playmates, guardians, and comfort for the Children you care for.

Across three Acts your Beloved will meet and guide six Children through life, as you contemplate your Beloved's role in their futures and in the wider world around them. You will accomplish this by answering questions, selecting prompts, and telling the intimate tale of a toy and the Children who love and need them.

boardgame.name: Nordpolsflygningen
boardgame.description:
Nordpolsflygningen (The North Pole flight).
Typical roll/spin and move board game for 2 players made in Sweden with playing pieces very similar to board games made at the same time in Germany.

Each player starts from different side of the board and should cross separate routes of 45 stops. The first player, who reach 45, wins a game.

Probable date is 1926 based on Amundsen's flight to the North Pole.

boardgame.name: Wisdom's Tales: Candy Island
boardgame.description:
In Wisdom's Tales, players take the role of one of the Master Wisdom apprentices on a mission to find King's Marshmallow castle and retrieve the Crown.

During the first half of the game, you and your team have to explore the Island by flipping tiles and resolving unpredicted events. Tiles, such as Caramel lake or Bombomb valley, will present some difficulties on your journey and will demand a bit of luck (dice) on your part. Stay close to your team, or wander in another direction, the objective is to locate the Castle and grab the Crown.

The second half starts at the moment a player grabs the crown. Now, you and your team will have to escape the Island, tracing back from your current location to the initial tile. But be aware: You're not only having to go back through all the difficult paths, but Chocolate guards will be on your track to take the Crown!

To successfully finish your mission, all players must get back to the start tile with the crown on one of the player's backpacks.

Will your team be successful on this quest, or will it succumb to those tricky, but weirdly delicious, candies?

boardgame.name: Heroclix: Fantastic Four
boardgame.description:
In this set, the Fantastic Four are joined by some of their favorite allies such as Wolverine, Ghost Rider and the Silver Surfer to take on some of their greatest nemesis. Dr Doom, Skrulls and the Frightful are just some of their enemies awaiting them on the battlefield. This

Heroclix set contains 16 Common, 16 Uncommon, 16 Rare, 12 Super Rare, 4 Prime and 6 Chase figures for you to collect.

boardgame.name: Froschlaune
boardgame.description:
Froschlaune is a game collection about feelings, only in German language. Included are 10 games 3 years and up. The cards show 24 frogs ... in different moods.

Included are among games in which you talk, learn and discuss upon feelings: A memogame, 2 moving games, a gesture game, a guessing game.

A fun game collection with cooperative and competitive games.

boardgame.name: Beneath The Wishing Tree
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Beyond the village there lies an enchanted forest. All your years you have heard tell of the Forest and all the treasures and dangers it holds within. All of these tales agree on a single thing -- the Forest is a wondrous place. Somewhere within the Forest, deep in its most enchanted groves, lies its heart: the Wishing Tree. The people in your village tell of those who have ventured into the Forest to find the Wishing Tree, seeking to have their heart’s desire granted by the unicorns who guard the Forest, singing of its wonders. You harbor your own secret wish. Although you have tried to ignore it, to remind yourself that it is foolhardy to make such a journey, you can no longer resist. You must have your wish granted. And so, you must venture deep into the Forest, find the Wishing Tree, and await a unicorn beneath it...

Beneath the Wishing Tree is a dreamy, introspective tarot game for one themed around wishes and the lengths we will go to to have them granted. To play it, you will need your favorite tarot deck and a copy of this game.

Content warning: this game contains mentions of the following sensitive topics.

Death, including animal death
Loss and upheaval
Transformation
War
Injury and Illness
Sacrifice
Infertility

boardgame.name: Black Box
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

What is Black Box?

Black Box is a single-player Tabletop Role-Playing Game (TTRPG) about hacking. It uses the Carta game system, and is designed to (fairly abstractly) simulate Black Box hacking--which is attempting to break into a network that you know almost nothing about going in.

You can play it as a standalone, single-session game, or as part of a larger hacking campaign. It could also be played as part of a different TTRPG about hacking.

boardgame.name: Blugard
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Blue King

Far back in the Neverwhen, before time can be remembered, you were King. The only King. The very energies of Creation coursed through your veins. Alas, time wounds all heals. Slowly, you ground to a halt, sinking into the earth.

Dead. Slumbering.

And yet, you carry on. Creation leeches from your bones into the world. As you decay and slip into nothingness, you form the basis of all existence in this world.

And so, you sleep and slip away, remembering.
Guardians

The King is guarded by the Blugard, ancient guardians tasked with defending the body that brings life to the world. It is known that the fate of all living beings is tied to the fate of one powerful corpse. Chosen for the loyalty and sense of duty, the guardians are sustained by faith and their proximity to the King's eternal energies. The guardians never leave the presence of the King. If their faith wavers, they are replaced by creatures more suited to the task.
Time & Rest

The King is in perpetual service. Entropy stops for no one. And yet, there will be downtime. Across the ages, not every moment is worth remembering. This is the Rest. During Rest, you will select how long the King is at Rest and wait the appropriate amount of time. This may be seconds or several minutes, representing the passage of time before a new Guardian is selected.

Blugard is a solo journaling roleplaying game based on the Lost & Found SRD. In it, you play a dead King, dreaming and giving life to the world through the ages.

boardgame.name: Borealis
boardgame.description: Borealis is a single-player card game in which you will quest throughout the icy north in search of the Borealis, a legendary shrine to the gods of winter, and confront all that you find along the way using the tools and the knowledge that you gain while doing so.

boardgame.name: Maglev Metro: Moonbases & Mars
boardgame.description:
Two brand new space-based recessed expansion maps for Maglev Metro that tweak the mechanics and how the game is played, giving the base game even more replayability.

Magnetic Levitation technology is the technology of choice for extra-terrestrial transportation, and your job is to build a network of maglev rails to assist in creating a lunar vacation destination, taking advantage of its 1/6th gravity and relatively flat surface.


Create your own personal moonbase where passengers arrive from Earth (even if your train is elsewhere)
Move four times as far (up to 16 stations when the action is maxed out) for no extra cost
Create a dual-color station in the middle of the map that can accept two different passenger types
Use new Brake and Reverse technology to make speeding around the map faster and more efficient
Build track to connect to your opponents' moonbases in order to pick up their passengers.


Mars' colonization has begun, and now it's time to connect locations with maglev railways.


Zip around the planet by building track all the way around it (instantly going from one side of the map to the other)
Use the new Launch action to send your train up above the atmosphere and deliver passengers to both Phobos and Deimos
No need for reverse on Mars, as your train moves backwards and forwards
Canyons are expensive to build on but provide access to critical stations, including the central launch station


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Bushido: Risen Sun – Shiho Shota
boardgame.description:
Having perfected the martial art of Kyudo that allows an archer to fire their bows with uncanny accuracy, Shiho Shota has become a legend in his own time. He even managed to fire an arrow throw the circular centre of a silvermoon that was thrown high in the air while blindfolded! But Shiho Shota is far more than trick-shots and showing off for the crowd; he has dedicated his entire life to mastering the bow, so much so that it is not an instrument in his hands but an extension of his body and fierce fighting spirit. The years have been hard on Shiho Shota, always hunted and on the run from the Dragon usurper, but such is his resolve; he has never let this wear him down. It has only doubled his will to fight now that the Black Eagle has flown home!

If you wish to run a Shiho warband with a ranged element, Shota is the perfect addition. He can reliably shoot anything. While his ordinary Dai Kyu shots are excellent, his ability to ignore LoS (Line of Sight) while shooting pushes him to the next level! However, the cost of an additional reload marker makes this a complex trade-off. His melee ability is average for Shiho Samurai, but he can benefit from an Enhancement Equipment weapon card. His melee ability is good enough to finish off the enemy models he has already damaged with his bow.

Blister contains one miniature supplied with a 30mm base and full colour profile card.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Bushido: Risen Sun – Loyal Kyudoka
boardgame.description:
Kyudo, the art of archery, has long been the pastime of the Samurai and those that perfect it become known as Kyudoka. It is extremely rare and frowned upon for anyone other than Samurai to take up a bow for whatever reason. However, the Shiho, with little access to black powder, have made the bow a formidable part of their arsenal. Shiho Shota, a master of Kyudo, has been training loyal Shiho Ashigaru to use this weapon to devastating effect. They can fire several volleys and disappear into the underbrush before an enemy force can even sound a call-to-arms. Shiho Hiroto, never one for rules or archaic tradition was ecstatic to learn that he had some of the finest archers in Jwar who were not Samurai but loyal Ashigaru instead. Shiho Hiroto is a champion of the people and not the power that forces them into submission.
They may only be Ashigaru, but they have a pool of three ranged and access to the Lightweight trait, making them some of the best missile troops in Bushido. For 14 Rice, they have outstanding Range - and Strength - and can keep their distance to stay safe. With the Eagle Feather Arrow as a choice, it gives them that chance to let loose that one vital shot that must do damage at all costs.

Blister contains two miniatures, 30mm bases and a full colour profile card.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Mouse Maze
boardgame.description:
Your application for ZooLabs has been accepted! You are now one of the candidates to work on a revolutionary study that, through labyrinth experiments, will teach mice to help people escape from natural disasters. On your first day at the lab, you are introduced to your new little friend, and together, you will discover new possibilities for rat intelligence.

In Mouse Maze, players represent young scientists working on various experiments, building the best mouse maze to maximize the mouse's path, trying to get through the most cheese and candy (positive points) while avoiding or closing the mousetraps (negative points).

It’s a flip and write game in which the players draw the walls of the maze, but it's the opponent who will trace the path (and of course, he’ll make the worst route possible). In each turn, one card is flipped to determine which kind of walls the players can draw, some of them including more cheese, candies, or new mousetraps.

The game has a campaign with 30 exciting episodes (split into 10 chapters) that can be played by 1 to 4 players. New rules, objectives and game elements are introduced with each episode, giving players new choices and strategies (without destroying any components). For players who do not want to experience the campaign, each episode can also be played independently of the campaign and out of order, as well as increasing the number of possible players.

That's 30 games in one, and you can choose the best one for you!

boardgame.name: Soldaten-Leben heißt allzeit lustig sein
boardgame.description:
Whole title: "Soldaten-Leben heißt allzeit lustig sein. Ein heiteres Würfel-Spiel für Front und Heimat" ("Soldier's life means always having fun. A cheerful dice game for front and home").
Typical roll and move game. The first player, who reach 75 square, wins the game.
This game was produced in World War II-era and was designed for Wehrmacht soldiers. They could play on the front or at home (like the title said).

—user summary

boardgame.name: A Delicate Matter
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is an adventure for use with Cepheus Engine.

While in Star Port the travelers are approached by a terrified looking diplomat. He has an important mission which requires discretion and skill. The heir to the throne on his home world has died under very unsavory circumstances on a brothel planet. He needs the body recovered and brought back to his home world without reporters or others discovering the circumstances of death.

This sounds easier than it truly is as the brothel planet has many reporters covering feminist protests there and the home world has reporters covering the celebrations of the monarchy reaching it's 1000th year of existence.

boardgame.name: The Syndicate at Sovad
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Syndicate at Sovad is a beginning adventure for 4-5 characters of 1st level. During the course of the adventure, the characters will advance to 5th level. The adventure is set in Sovad, an alpine village that can be easily transplanted into any fantasy setting. The adventure was designed for Dungeons & Dragons Fifth Edition, but can easily be modified for any fantasy tabletop roleplaying game system.

"A darkness has been spreading throughout the land. Members of a criminal society known only as the Black Sphinx Syndicate have been convening annually in the remote township of Sovad for some nefarious purpose. Up until now, the nature of these meetings has been cloaked in secrecy. Head officials working for the Crown’s high command have assembled an elite taskforce to travel to Sovad and try to retrieve intel on the details of these yearly gatherings. Now you and your fellow adventurers await a special delivery beside a black lamppost along a wooded road at twilight. What lies ahead in Sovad, and do you have what it takes to accomplish your mission?"

boardgame.name: The Caverns of Draconis
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The following game and adventure have been designed to reimagine what the fictional module featured in the episode might look like. This rules-lite RPG is meant to serve as an introduction for newcomers and fans of the show alike. The game can be played with 2-9 players and has everything you need to get started except for dice.

boardgame.name: The Doomed District of the Gilded Lung
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Crown’s capital is in a state of disarray. A new pathogen has appeared in the city and has begun ravaging the Mercantile District, leading to a quarantine order from the King himself. Intel gleaned from within the affected district traced the disease back to the noble Ephraim Daeus’ death at the opium den a week prior.

The Doomed District of the Gilded Lung is a self-contained D&D 5E module that can either be used as a follow up to The Psionic Crucible of the Fat Cannibal and The Crypts of Caverndel, or deployed as a standalone fantasy adventure. The module was designed for a party of 5th level characters.

boardgame.name: Equinox Shamans
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A little something extra for your PF2 game!

The mysterious shaman class from Pathfinder Roleplaying Game mastered spirits and bound them to the land, and Legendary Games reintroduced this class for Pathfinder Second Edition as a bridge between the occult and the divine. Now you can expand your shaman's bond with the spirits of nature with spirits of Autumn and Spring and half a dozen fantastic focus spells like refreshing breeze, rabbit's pace, and reaping ruin!

boardgame.name: Crimson Ridge
boardgame.description:
Crimson Ridge is a strategic two player card game in which heroes battle each other to capture arenas for their faction by spilling the blood of their enemies. Players play cards face down and reveal them simultaneously to resolve battles. The strategy comes from knowing what your opponent has left in their deck and forecasting their next move. Winning a battle captures an arena for your faction and earns you Victory Points. Crimson Ridge captures the strategy, speed and brutality of melee combat duels in a card game that can be played in ten to fifteen minutes.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: GOLDblivion
boardgame.description:
A double-deck-building fantasy game about building a colony, fighting dragons and getting gold. Be the first to get 10 gold ingots to be crowned King or Queen of GOLDblivion!

In GOLDblivion, you have two decks of cards to manage: one for combat and one for your colony. Every turn starts with colonizing by removing a card from your hand. This card is placed on your player board and will add a precious resource of your choice to your reserve all game long. This will also naturally clean your deck from bad cards!

Combat is made by attacking enemies represented by tiles. The number of free spaces around a tile is the number of cards you draw from your combat deck to kill the enemy. They get increasingly stronger and are more rewarding too!

Based on the ever-changing cards in the market, develop a long-term strategy and find the best combinations between elf, dwarf, human and building cards to maximize your gold and be crowned King or Queen of GOLDblivion!

All in all, it's 120 cards, 3 boards, 6 tokens, 2 meeples, 12 tokens, 12 enemy tiles, 8 wooden cubes, 2 rule books and 20 awesome looking gold nuggets!

Get rich and rule the GOLDblivion kingdom!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Saga (Feb 2022)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This issue I discuss how spellcasters can recover after accruing Ravage points. Don't know what Ravaging is? I cover that too. After that learn about the Nulthari, the mages who burned the world to defeat their enemies. Dane then gives us an article about what the art of Frazetta means to him. And we wrap it up with a visit to the Darkwinter Tavern.

boardgame.name: Serpentine Hill Road
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Dock Ward Narrow Streets

This is an .MP4 video battlemap compatible with any RPG game. The easiest way to use it is to play it on a TV laid flat on top of a low table - 40” TV would be the perfect fit for the gridded versions of my maps (but there's always gridless versions for other TV sizes). You can also use a projector or VTT like Roll20.

boardgame.name: Descent Into Swamp
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Descent Into Swamp

This is an .MP4 video battlemap compatible with any RPG game. The easiest way to use it is to play it on a TV laid flat on top of a low table - 40” TV would be the perfect fit for the gridded versions of my maps (but there's always gridless versions for other TV sizes). You can also use a projector or VTT like Roll20.

boardgame.name: Sewers Entrance
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Sewers Entrance 4k

This is an .MP4 video battlemap compatible with any RPG game. The easiest way to use it is to play it on a TV laid flat on top of a low table - 40” TV would be the perfect fit for the gridded versions of my maps (but there's always gridless versions for other TV sizes). You can also use a projector or VTT like Roll20.

boardgame.name: Post-Apocalyptic School 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Post-Apocalyptic School 2

This is an .MP4 video battlemap compatible with any RPG game. The easiest way to use it is to play it on a TV laid flat on top of a low table - 40” TV would be the perfect fit for the gridded versions of my maps (but there's always gridless versions for other TV sizes). You can also use a projector or VTT like Roll20.

boardgame.name: Celestial
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Celestial

This is an .MP4 video battlemap compatible with any RPG game. The easiest way to use it is to play it on a TV laid flat on top of a low table - 40” TV would be the perfect fit for the gridded versions of my maps (but there's always gridless versions for other TV sizes). You can also use a projector or VTT like Roll20.

boardgame.name: Axe Wielding Priest
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A great evil stalks your parish. It changes shapes, forms, and faces at will; no one would believe you if you told them, but you know it is there. And you know what you must do.

Yes, sometimes you’ve had… lapses in judgment. But do not entertain doubt, for doubt is the greatest weapon in the Adversary’s arsenal. Focus instead on what you need to do your righteous work: clarity of vision and the will to act.

That, and a sharp fuckin’ axe.

boardgame.name: Yosemite
boardgame.description:
Welcome to the Annual Yosemite National Park photo contest. It’s time for you to show off your skills! Take the best pictures of our beautiful park and impress our judges to with the title of “Photographer of the Year!”

Yosemite is a fast-paced, competitive strategy game for two players based on the landmarks of Yosemite National Park. In this game, you’ll travel through the park, take pictures of the animals and the landmarks, and go camping and fishing. Be the one who impresses the judges the most (scores the most points) in order to win the coveted title of “Photographer of the Year.”

Each turn, you’ll move your photographer one space in any direction, or more, according to that animal on your tile! These movements are all thematic to the specific animal, and dangerous animals can move your opponent as well! For example the Red Fox’s agility lets you move one, two, or three spaces, changing direction on the way, while the Cougar moves one direction, right to the edge of the board, knocking your opponent if they’re in the way. You’ll also collect that animal tile after using their movement, which you can use for photo cards and bonuses!

It's a tense back and forth as you and your opponent maneuver for the best positions and the best photos, try to impress the judges, and fight over the best campsites and landmarks. With strategic movement and a variety of ways to score, Yosemite is fast and challenging, keeping you and your opponent on your toes as you explore the beautiful park.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Age of Conan: Cloth Bags
boardgame.description:
Add Two Age of Conan Cloth Bags, to store your “Crom, Count the Dead” and “Sorcery” Tokens.

CONTENTS OF THE BOX
1 Bags for Skull Coins
1 Bags for Scroll Coins

One Set of 2 Bags.

Line: AGE OF CONAN KS
KS ACCESSORY
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Age of Conan: The Strategy Board Game

boardgame.name: Aristotle Brown and the Codex of Fate
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

It's 1937. The Adolf Hitler rules Germany and the shadow of the Nazi party is spreading a pall across Europe. Dictators have arisen in other countries such as Mussolini in Italy and tensions are high. The US government walks a tightrope trying to impede Nazi efforts without drawing overt attention.
boardgame.rpg: Aristotle Brown and the Codex of Fate

boardgame.name: Behind These Masks
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Behind These Masks is a game where you play the role of a parole judge deciding the final verdict on if a criminal should be allowed back into society or stay behind bars. Your choice could allow a person a 2nd chance at life, or allow them to add more victims to their roster. Your choices have consequences in this game.

boardgame.name: Golden Oldies
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Decades ago, around the time of World War II, you were a superhero. You've passed the torch over to the next generation. You've taken on a hybrid role in a team made up of superteens and your old comrades, balancing mentorship with team heroics. But you're feeling pulled to more fully commit to just mentoring or focusing on active heroics. What will you decide?

boardgame.name: TTMC: Format de voyage, vol. 1
boardgame.description:
TTMC: Format de Voyage is a mix of party and trivia games. Self-assess your knowledge from 1 to 10 on a variety of uncommon, interesting and random themes, this time with questions about trave!

Be the first to reach the final card by answering the questions you chose. Each team will self-assess itself from 1 to 10 on a multitude of topics. Each grade has a more or less complex question: the higher the grade, the more difficult the question. If you answer it right, the team will go up the number of boxes corresponding to their self-rated score. For example, if you answer correctly question 6, you will advance 6 boxes.

It's funny, accessible to everyone and there is plenty to play with: 130 cards and 860 questions, with the added value of original cards to spice up the game. It can be played as a standalone game or an expansion of the original TTMC.

The goal of the game is to be the first to get to the end of the board by answering the questions asked.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Versions & Editions: Travel Versions of Non-Travel Games

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Hard Case
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

It's always raining downtown. The streetlights flicker, cutting the world into swathes of light and shadow.

People scurry down streets and around corners, collars up, hats down, and always looking over their shoulder.

boardgame.name: Second Chance
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

What would you give to have a second chance at life? To become powerful? To become important?

Would you leave everyone you love behind? Would you be able to start a new life in a world where it traded technology for magic? Would you put your life on the line to stop a powerful threat?

boardgame.name: Thank You for the Subs
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Camera, ready. Microphone, ready. Headphone, ready. Computer, ready. The setup is perfect. And you are ready to start your stream now. Will your stream end with your subscriber count skyrocketing? Or will your stream be on #livestreamfail? Play to find out!

boardgame.name: Bloodstained Hands
boardgame.description:
From the Kickstarter:

In Bloodstained Hands you will play as a person engaged in a dangerous ritual to achieve a pardon from the souls of those you have killed.

You have come here by your own free will. Maybe because the guilt is too heavy. Maybe because it is necessary to achieve your goals. Maybe because this is the only place where you can be.

boardgame.name: The Winter Guard
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You have known since birth that one day your shift would come. Each season, a guard to keep it bound. Each guard, to ensure the door never opened. You were excited to test yourself and knew to heed your elders’ warnings. Do not listen to its honeyed words. Do not speak lest you reveal your own weakness. But the winter is long and dark and you are so alone. And the voice from behind the door almost feels like home…

boardgame.name: The Getaway
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The bank job was supposed to be by the numbers – in and out in 7 minutes, then you drive everyone to safety.

The job wasn’t by the numbers. Cops were all over the crew as soon as they walked in the bank. They’re done for, but not you. Not so long as you’ve got this car, some open road, and a whole lot of luck.

Punch it.

boardgame.name: Charge RPG
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In this game, you and your friends get together to tell an interactive story about a group of fictional characters facing, and trying to overcome obstacles. You decide how the characters resolve those challenges, and how the world reacts to those actions.

boardgame.name: Charge SRD
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Charge SRD is a condensed version of the rules of Charge RPG that you can use to make your own Powered by Charge games.

boardgame.name: Lost Warehouse of the Shaduri Emporium
boardgame.description:
The Shaduri were a merchant kingdom who believed everything has value, you just need to find where. With this in mind they opened portals to fifty other Planes of existence, and kept warehouses stocked with every possible good, from scraps of molding leather, to cascading power crystals.

This warehouse is a recent find, tucked away in the Evenfall Hills. It is completely stocked with all manner of crates, waiting for transport, untouched by time. What is in the crates is as much a mystery as how large the warehouse is. This could be the find of a lifetime! Or it could spell your doom.

boardgame.name: The Last Outpost
boardgame.description:
A campaign starter adventure for Pathfinder, the real one, for characters first to third level, but second level would probably
work best.

Player are hired to scout a long abandoned outpost that was the last stop in the Kedlar pass before it
reached the town of Andoval.

boardgame.name: Det Bästa ur Drakborgen Återväckt
boardgame.description:
This is a reissue of a selection of new cards and rules taken from "Drakborgen Återväckt", a 2010 fan expansion to the original Drakborgen (1985).

Drakborgen Återväckt is a popular game variant of Drakborgen created by Simon Lundström and Erik Zetterberg. We are releasing an adaptation of the best from Drakborgen Resurrected as a separate rule and card supplement for pledge level HERO and up.

boardgame.name: Aux Armes!
boardgame.description:
A set of 9mm Napoleonic miniatures rules published in issue #61 of Panzerfaust magazine.

It was meant for fairly compact battles, with 4-5 figures for a battalion with a 1.5"x0.5" stand, and decent battles playable in a three foot square area.

This was the basis for the later Grand Army rules published in 1975.

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Stationfall: 3D minis
boardgame.description:
Set of 27 3D characters for Stationfall. Scale: 40 mm.

They're designed to replace the wooden character pawns from the base game and are used to populate the game board.

These are:

· Astrochimp
· Billionaire
· Boarder
· Botanist
· Colonel
· Consort
· Corpsicle
· Counsellor
· Cyborg
· Daredevil
· Digital Assistant
· Doctor
· Engineer
· Exile
· Inspector
· Legal
· Maintenance Clones
· Medical
· Microbiologist
· Operative
· Security
· Station Chief
· Stowaway
· Stranger
· Telepathic Rat
· Troubleshooter
· Drones

boardgame.name: Astonishing Super Heroes: Basic Rulebook
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

It's your turn to the be the hero!

Astonishing Super Heroes is a roleplaying game of superpowered action and drama. Streamlining the classic FASERIP system from the ground up via the OGL, Astonishing Super Heroes plays faster and adds dramatic roleplay mechanics to better represent the variety of challenges superheroes face in the comics, shows, and movies we love so much.

The Basic Rulebook includes:

Everything you need to emulate superpowered characters from any comic, TV show, or movie universe you're already familiar with.
A revamped Karma system inspired by modern narrative RPGs and customized to your superhero's identity: play an inspiring moral paragon, a clever mystic willing to deal with dark powers, a violent antihero, or a reformed villain.
Rules that promote teamwork and that can be as tactical or freeform as you want.
New rules for challenging social interactions using a stress and resolve mechanic, as well as leveraging money and resources against your foes.
30 pages devoted to building custom super powers and gear, with over 100 fully-built powers as examples.


The Basic Rulebook also features great character sheets and comprehensive reference sheets, making it a breeze to run! Plus, it's fully compatible with other FASERIP games, and broadly compatible with most four color supers games.

boardgame.name: Stationfall: Neoprene mat
boardgame.description:
Expanded neoprene mat with the game board and extra slots for character cards and tokens.

—user description

boardgame.name: Our Special Place
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Inspired by the Silent Hill game series, in this zine we walk you through rural Ashfield Heights. This zine is a little different than our normal format, since this style of psychological horror is meant to be personal and surreal. The book is full of areas, scenes, parts of Ashfield with strange locals to meet, and even stranger monsters to harrow your hunters.

Inside, you'll find ideas and guidance for how to personalize the harrowing tales of Ashfield Heights. Then, quickly we jump into the town itself, featuring landmarks such as Mirror Lake, the Amusement Park, the Heights of Faith Junior High School, the Road Cafe, the Path by the Woods, and the Historical Society. If your hunters make it that far, they can step through the Threshold to face their deepest insecurities and fears made flesh.

Are you ready to take a walk into the darkness with us?

boardgame.name: They Came From Camp Murder Lake!
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

You run as fast as you can, but there he’ll be, right behind you whenever you look over your shoulder.

You can hide under the bed, and it might be the last place she checks, but I promise she’ll check.

You can riddle their body with bullets, gouge at their flesh with blades, run over them with your car, but they’ll be lurching back to life as soon as you’re out of shot.

The creatures, the entities, the killers, the slashers from Camp Murder Lake and elsewhere will never stop their spree.

But maybe, just maybe, you might be the sole survivor at the end of the movie.

They Came from Camp Murder Lake! is a sourcebook for Players and Directors wanting to embrace the thrills and horrors of the 1970s and 1980s slasher movie genre, when arguably, it was at its peak.

This game presents everything you need to play a terrifying horror movie in the style of Halloween, Friday the 13th, A Nightmare on Elm Street, The Texas Chainsaw Massacre, and every other favorite of the slasher set.

They Came from Camp Murder Lake! uses the Storypath System, which you can find in the pages of the They Came from Beyond the Grave! rulebook.

They Came from Camp Murder Lake! includes:

Five new playable Archetypes and a multitude of new Origins and Ambitions!
New Cinematics, Quips, Stunts, and a new mechanic: The Twist!
A panoply of dread-inducing slashers, including cannibals, dream stalkers, evil children, killer clowns, homicidal hitchhikers, chameleonic stepfathers, and many, many more!
All the guidance a Director needs for running games filled with suspense and scares, including variant styles of gameplay beyond the expected slasher movie arcs and a thorough presentation of potential settings!
A full scenario you can run straight from the pages of this book! Get murdering!
boardgame.rpg: They Came from Beyond the Grave!

boardgame.name: Bakers, Charge!
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

If you've ever wished you could compete in one of those awesome baking shows or you just love watching them but want to fix all their mistakes (ah! they need to prove that bread longer!) - now is your chance!

Play with your friends and family as contestants in a baking competition! Show off your prowess in each round of the competition as you design interesting breads, pastries, and cakes while handling twists ranging from needing to feed a huge crowd to working around banned ingredients. Just make sure you've got all your elements finished before the tart timer runs out of slices!

boardgame.name: The Path of the Wolves
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Publisher's blurb:

In this game, you play as Wolves. Humans who went through intense mutations as kids to adapt their body in becoming dangerous weapons against the monsters plaguing the world. People are scared of your kind, but will still hire you to do the dirty job.

boardgame.name: Trouble at Santa's Workshop
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Trouble at Santa's Workshop is a kid friendly mini tabletop role-playing game where you play as Santa's helpers to help prevent some trouble from happening to Christmas!
boardgame.rpgitemversion: Des ennuis à l'atelier du père Noël
Guai nel Laboratorio di Babbo Natale
Problemas en el taller de Santa

boardgame.name: Il Faut Sauver Laurent
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In this game, you play a "super parent" and you got to save your kid from some terrible situation.

Use your super-parent powers, consume shots of espresso to stay ahead of the game but try not to shame your kid in the process of saving them!

boardgame.name: Smart10: Music
Smart10: Musiikki
Smart10: Musik
boardgame.description:
The expansion includes 100 new questions and 1000 new answers.
The theme of the questions is music and include subjects such as pop-musicians, bands, songs, albums, genres, countries and decades.
You can switch the question cards with two theme decks or mix these music questions with half of the general question cards.

boardgame.name: StoryGuider
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

StoryGuider is intended to help you make simple stories with your kid(s) so they can get used to tabletop role-playing games (TTRPGs), decision-making, problem-solving, etc.

It focuses only on the RP side of TTRPGs (there are no dice or rule mechanics). This is so kids can get used to playing as a character and changing the story without having to simultaneously worry about learning mechanics that they are not familiar with. It is a stepping stone into playing more rules-based TTRPGs.

User summary:

Includes a sample, playable, fantasy scenario: The Magician's Big Performance.

boardgame.name: Death by Lanternlight
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Travel through the Gloamswood is fraught with danger—brigands, wild animals, and monsters abound. Deep within the forest, the Wistful Way Inn serves as a respite for weary travelers. Little does any guest know that death lurks under the floorboards of this inn.

When your party stops here for the night, can they interpret the ghostly whispers that keep them awake? Can they solve the mystery of the missing guest? And can they unravel the terrible bargain that was struck long ago and free the inn’s proprietor from her ghastly deal?

Find out in Death by Lanternlight, a new adventure from Lunch Break Heroes for the world’s greatest roleplaying game!

This adventure is compatible with the fifth edition Dungeons & Dragons ruleset, and is suitable for 4-6 characters of 1st or 2nd level.

boardgame.name: The Hunger
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Have you bit off more than you can chew?

In The Hunger, adventurers arrive in the remote mining village of Dawnvale. Following rumors of recent disappearances, they must set about investigating a village full of colorful but untrusting characters in order to unravel the mystery and discover the horrors that lurk in the shadows. Can they solve the mystery and keep their heads about them? Or will they become the next to disappear in the darkness of Dawnvale?

This adventure is compatible with the fifth edition 5e ruleset, and is suitable for 3-5 characters of 5th level.

boardgame.name: Marvelous Merfolk: Compendium of PC Races
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Welcome to the Marvelous Merfolk Compendium of PC Races! Merfolk are legendary water-dwelling human-like beings. They are attested in folklore and mythology throughout the ages in various parts of the world. While the standard setting offers a pittance of various merfolk races, this book stands to rectify that by providing a veritable rainbow of 22 playable merfolk races to entertain, inspire, and educate players and Game Masters alike. Aside from a small handful of races that draw on material in Psionics Unleashed (Dreamscarred Press), this tome is intended to work with Paizo Publishing’s Pathfinder RPG core books alone. Although the races can be used in the Cerulean Seas Campaign Setting (Alluria Publishing), this setting is not required to use this tome. In addition, this tome provides optional mechanics for buoyancy, drag, water pressure, and water current to add a bit more realism to your aquatic encounters.

boardgame.name: Feast of the Damned
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Give your players the night of their lives!

All is well in the town of Garrenhollow, where the local lords dine with the common folk. But beneath the veneer of charity and good will lay the dark hearts of cursed nobility. Adventurers find themselves invited to the Sinclair estate for a tour of the grounds, a succulent dinner, and a good night’s rest, only to find themselves the quarry of a sadistic hunt. Can they survive the night? Will they be predator or prey? And can they find a way to break the curse that holds the Sinclair family in its sway? Find out in FEAST OF THE DAMNED.

This adventure is compatible with the fifth edition Dungeons & Dragons ruleset, and is suitable for 3-5 characters of 3rd level.

boardgame.name: Steve Jackson's Munchkin Presents Batman
boardgame.description: Steve Jackson's Munchkin Presents Batman features more than 250 cards based on characters and settings in DC Comics' Batman universe.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Krosmaster: Arena – Arpagone Old Promo
boardgame.description:
Promotional Figure with a unique card profile for the Krosmaster: Arena game. A greedy Enutrof that can pay extra Kamas to make her spells stronger.

Note that this minor expansion comes with its unique rule set (profile card) for a new character. Arpagone included in the original "Brotherhood of the Forgotten" expansion has a different rule set.

boardgame.name: Best Candy on the Block: Rewrapped
boardgame.description:
Best Candy on the Block: Rewrapped is a revised edition, with an updated deck and rule set, of Best Candy on the Block. It uses ranked cards with multiple candy themed suits like chocolate and marshmallow depicting different treats that you may receive while trick-or-treating.

Each hand, players choose a favorite flavor from 3 cards dealt from a separate flavor deck. Each trick you win, and each card you take that matches your favorite flavor gives you 1 point. However, each hand, the player who won the most tricks does not earn points for tricks they took because of a tummy ache, they still earn points from cards they took with their favorite flavor.

Additionally there are Prank cards that can be played instead of treats. Pranks are worth -1 point at the end of the trick to the person that took them, and a trick with a prank rotates the leader of the next trick to the right of the winner. There are also Non-Candy cards which can be used to avoid winning a trick and King cards which have powers that can change how the trick they are played to works.

The game ends when one player has reached at least 31 points. The player with the most points, wins.

boardgame.name: 1941: Race to Moscow – Axis Aircraft Expansion
boardgame.description:
Deluxe set of three Junkers Ju86 figures and one S-Boat figure in player colors.

The models are 1:300 scale.

This box set was available to backers of the 1941: Race to Moscow Kickstarter.

listing.notes:
