Title: 1941: Race to Moscow – Axis Aircraft Expansion Publisher: PHALANX Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Dock Ward Narrow Streets
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Dock Ward Narrow Streets

This is an .MP4 video battlemap compatible with any RPG game. The easiest way to use it is to play it on a TV laid flat on top of a low table - 40” TV would be the perfect fit for the gridded versions of my maps (but there's always gridless versions for other TV sizes). You can also use a projector or VTT like Roll20.

boardgame.name: A Fowl Endeavour
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Ever wanted to fight a horse-sized duck?

A Fowl Endeavour is a first level adventure that takes approximately 2-4 hours. The adventure is designed to either act as an introductory module for a party or as a one-shot. It can also act as a bridging session as your party travels between places. While this is a first level adventure we encourage using the scenario and locations at higher levels. Let us know how it goes and how your party succeeds or fails at their endeavour! Find our matching dice set for this adventure here.

boardgame.name: Becket's Lost Yuletide
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In the bustling Volsegrad City, one man seems to have lost all conception of who he is, and is desperate to get his memories back before Yuletide.

This is a Level 10 Only Crits one-shot that takes approximately 2-5 hours. The adventure is designed to either act as a high level one-shot module for a party or, or can also act as a bridging session as your party travels between places. We encourage using the scenario and locations throughout your game. Let us know how it goes and how your party succeeds or fails at their endeavour!

boardgame.name: Hunt of the Crangtar Terror
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Hunt of the Crangtar Terror is a 5th level one shot adventure designed to take 3-5 hours to play. The party begins in Crangtar, a small farming village seat at a crossroads between roads to larger, more prosperous cities. The village has recently been set upon by some strange beast or band of men, and nearly half their flocks have disappeared, along with a great deal of stored grain.

boardgame.name: The Mountain Killer
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Mountain Killer adventure is three levels, and takes a party of four from level six to nine. It takes place in the capital city of Jamp, the center of governance and trade in Acrit, the Mountain Kingdom. The party is hired by a bereaved mother when her son is found dead. The death appeared to be a suicide, but the mother is confident it is a set up.

boardgame.name: The Missing Boxes
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Only Crits Official Christmas One-Shot! The Missing Boxes is a winter holiday themed one shot dungeon crawl. It’s designed for a 4 person party playing at level 5.

boardgame.name: The Dagger Dice of Bismuth
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Ever wanted a loaded dice set?

The Dagger Dice of Bismuth is a 5th level One-Shot adventure designed for a party of four to take 3-6 hours to play. The party has found themselves in the port town of Bismuth, a sprawling low settlement full of hard sailors from around the world. There are three areas of note in Bismuth: the Portly Cauldron, the Quay, and the Shipyards. Two quests that send the adventurers in the same direction can be found in town, the search for a missing wife and the hunt for the Loaded Dagger Dice. After being given one or both of these quests and finding out more about the town and surrounding area, the party strikes out North. Find our matching dice set for this adventure here.

boardgame.name: Pride of Kings
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Solve the mystery of the king's contest, and chart a new course for the central dominant province of Totus. Welcome to The Pride of Kings, a 5e adventure that takes the players from level 1 to level 3. In this prequel to the debut Only Crits adventure, Emperor's End, discover the origins of the famous Amelia, earn your place as an Aldoran specialists, and conquer every challenge laid out for you. Witness fun new rules, exciting NPCs and a plot that will keep you guessing. From kings to ghosts to dragons, do you have what it takes to claim the ultimate prize?

boardgame.name: The Fallen Crown
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A military coup by a malicious and deranged Colonel against the popular legitimate leader, trouble in the streets as enforcers abuse their power to keep the populace in line, a mysterious plot that ravages the city, and a conspiracy to weaken and take down the illegitimate, oppressive dictator. The citystate of Jeziblan needs heroes, lest it fall victim to the darkness being harnessed by those that seized its walls. Will the Party successfully save the town and set right the wrongs that led to its civil strife!

boardgame.name: 눈과 비로 만든 세계
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

가장 차가운 눈과 비로 빚어 만든 세계를, 당신에게.

수록 시나리오 타이만 4편
-Last thursdayism
-1cm 랑데부
-수몰버스
-낡은 기계의 자장가

※ 사망, 사고 및 자살, 시신 묘사, 재난에 관한 묘사가 다수 존재 합니다.
※ 일부 시나리오의 경우 독자적 룰을 사용하며, 신화 생물에 대한 라이터의 독자적 해석이 포함되어 있습니다.

boardgame.name: The Imperial Zoo
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Frau Vera Warnicke — It is with great pleasure that I write to inform you that I have at last received funding to commission the expeditions of which we lately spoke. Indeed, I expect that our patron should extend his largess to pay for not one, but three trips into the wild places of the Empire and beyond in pursuit of knowledge. I trust that those individuals you spoke of are available, and that they should be just as competent as you promised. I mean no mere foray into the hinterlands, to be back in time for supper in the University. These shall be true explorations of the deepest depths there are, for only the most impressive specimens could hope to excite those jaded academics of the Imperial Zoo.
...
The Imperial Zoo is a bestiary and travelogue of three daring expeditions into the Old World, ranging from the heights of Karak Kadrin to the city of Miragliano in the southern land of Tilea. It includes profiles for over 60 unique creatures, beasts and monsters of the Old World perfect to challenge even the most competent of adventurers. Also included are six new pregenerated Characters, each with their own skills, talents, and shady past, perfect to pick up and dive into a campaign focused on the truly mammoth threats that stalk the Old World.

boardgame.name: Wallop!
boardgame.description:
Crash! Bang! Wallop! In this exciting game of strategy and luck. The leader which is chosing by who looks the strongest will shout WALLOP! the leader gets first dibs on action cards and every round a new leader is passed in clockwise order. Once the round starts all rounds only last for 30 seconds. This game is played simultaneously so there are no turns or turn order.

First all players roll 2 D6 dice then picks 1 of the rolls to keep and draws an action card based on the number shown on the die.
Action cards can be used at any time unless a card says otherwise.
Always leave 1 action card face up of each number out in the playing area.
Action cards help you deal damage block damage heal you and some may even have special effects no other card ability can do.

At the end of a turn all cards you havn't used get discarded. Each player starts with 30 health and
players keep taking turns until 1 survivor is left alive.

boardgame.name: Lair of the Manticore! (5E)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Since the sea has disappeared, there have been endless rumors of ancient ruins, treasure, and beasts only mentioned in myth and legend. Most recently there has been a rumor going around Avillion that a wounded Manticore has made its home deep in the north-east marshes of the Barrow Lands. These rumors have reached the ears of a wealthy, but eccentric noble who has placed a large bounty on the live capture of the beast.

The Journey to and from the last known location of The Manticore itself is treacherous, fraught with the dangers of monsters, roving bands of brigands, and competing groups of cutthroat adventurers. The fog covered terrain is stony uneven earth and overgrown with tangleweeds and grass. IF the adventurers make it to the edge of the riparian swamp a sweet siren song beckons the adventurers forward into the dimly lit forest ahead...

boardgame.name: Lair of the Manticore! (SWADE)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Since the sea has disappeared, there have been endless rumors of ancient ruins, treasure, and beasts only mentioned in myth and legend. Most recently there has been a rumor going around Avillion that a wounded Manticore has made its home deep in the north-east marshes of the Barrow Lands. These rumors have reached the ears of a wealthy, but eccentric noble who has placed a large bounty on the live capture of the beast.

The Journey to and from the last known location of The Manticore itself is treacherous, fraught with the dangers of monsters, roving bands of brigands, and competing groups of cutthroat adventurers. The fog covered terrain is stony uneven earth and overgrown with tangleweeds and grass. IF the adventurers make it to the edge of the riparian swamp a sweet siren song beckons the adventurers forward into the dimly lit forest ahead...

boardgame.name: Lair of the Manticore! (Tiny D6)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Since the sea has disappeared, there have been endless rumors of ancient ruins, treasure, and beasts only mentioned in myth and legend. Most recently there has been a rumor going around Avillion that a wounded Manticore has made its home deep in the north-east marshes of the Barrow Lands. These rumors have reached the ears of a wealthy, but eccentric noble who has placed a large bounty on the live capture of the beast.

The Journey to and from the last known location of The Manticore itself is treacherous, fraught with the dangers of monsters, roving bands of brigands, and competing groups of cutthroat adventurers. The fog covered terrain is stony uneven earth and overgrown with tangleweeds and grass. IF the adventurers make it to the edge of the riparian swamp a sweet siren song beckons the adventurers forward into the dimly lit forest ahead...

boardgame.name: Xenoblade Chronicles 3
boardgame.description: A brand-new story that ties together the futures of the worlds depicted in Xenoblade Chronicles and Xenoblade Chronicles 2

boardgame.name: Fire Emblem Warriors: Three Hopes
boardgame.description: Fire Emblem

boardgame.name: Napoleonic Kalinatactic
boardgame.description:
A brief (two pages) set of Napoleonic miniatures rules published in Panzerfaust #56.

Normal units are battalions of 24 figures, split into six stands of four each (for changing formations). No scale or preferred figure size is given, though considering the era 12 or 9mm figures are likely.

The main element of the rules was the use of written movement orders, so that all movement could be done simultaneously.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Dark Hand
boardgame.description: Dual Playing cards, allowing for a number of game variations. Rules for various games are available from the Dark Hand website.
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: The United States Playing Card Company

boardgame.name: RoboDante
boardgame.description:
The goal of the game is guiding a robot Dante through hell's demons and looking for an enchanted charm.

The game was created for the CONSTRUCT COMMUNITY GAME JAM of January 2019

boardgame.name: Writers
boardgame.description:
Writers is a game where you play as a writer and try to be the first in typing random excerpts from the book. Fight against your friends or players around the world, make your way to the top and show them speed you are capable of. Become a member of Writer's club and master all language leagues!
Features


8 Game Modes. Do you want to take a duel with your friend? Type a random text or master a daily fixed excerpt? Or maybe Numbers? Choose your way from eight game modes: Duel, Duel Hard, Classic, Fixed, Marathon, Unmistakable, Unmistakable Hard, Numbers.



Language Leagues. You can choose the language you want to type. Now there are two leagues: English and Russian.



22 unlockable characters. You can choose from 22 (or maybe there is more?) characters to become the fastest writer. But you have to try hard to unlock them all.



Stats and Achievements. Each language league has its own statistic and leaderboards. You can watch the information about your CPM, Mistakes and other stats.



Improve your typing skills. To win you will have to type without looking on the keyboard. Playing regularly you will be able to use Touch typing technic to be even faster. Then you can use it at your work, study. And, of course, at furious battles in comments.


Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Dantes Bullet Inferno
boardgame.description:
Dantes Bullet Inferno is a shoot-em-up where the player fights against hell as Dante. This top down shooter includes a speedrun mode called time-dilation.

Experience the sequel to the historical epic Dante’s Inferno, by descending into hell and finishing of the Devil!
Shoot, dodge, and prevail through the five unforgiving levels in this hectic shoot em up!

Fight hell's demons on two planes, and utilize riding the danger zone for more firepower. If your skills are up to par, take on the speed-run mode Time Dilation!

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Duck's Inferno
boardgame.description:
Duck’s Inferno is a fun and challenging Action/Runner game. Fly through the nine circles of Dante’s Hell! Improve your hand agility dodging fatal blows and slashing demon hordes. Grab awesome prizes and win the epic battle against Evil!

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Ashes Reborn: Team Covenant Ashes Reborn Discord League Alternate Art Bundle 04
boardgame.description:
A set of four alternate alt cards that came with a successful completion of the Team Covenant Ashes Discord League that started on March 2nd, 2022.

This bundle includes:
1x Jessa Na Ni alternate art card
3x Anchornaut alternate art card
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Ashes Reborn: Rise of the Phoenixborn

boardgame.name: Red and the Deadly Sins
boardgame.description:
Acute social subtext about life from the perspective of “Divine Comedy” – this is how the Red and the Deadly Sins is presented by indie-studio Diantong, that consists of two friends-co-founders. Under its uncomplicated design developers hide plenty of allusions about reality, and a journey of a faceless hero is telling another interpretation of Dante Alighieri’s masterpiece.

Explore the underworld, inhabited by evil souls and save them. It is an order of Soul Purging Committee, and that’s what Red will do - an ordinary soldier without a name, face nor past. But even a usual man can clear the world from the Sins if he has enough determination and faith.

Leave your hope anyone who downloads the game:


Minimalist design. Co-founders of Diantong believe the power of the statement is more important than vivid visual aspect;
To overcome the Sin is simple, but to understand it’s essence – that’s the trial for the real explorers. Search for the memory shards, in order to know the truth about ancient spirits. To understand what Diantong wanted to say;
Authentic soundtrack from an independent songwriter Lamark Kane;
One book is seen differently in various cultures. Inspired by “Divine Comedy”, Diantong blended its vision of Dante’s journey and Chinese philosophy of life (by all means). Developers have put existential and social subtext in everything, from the mask of Red and traps to bosses and game ending.


Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: In Vulnerability
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The second adventure set in Shoreline, one of the Domains of Delight in the Feywild.

The party is involved in a wild magic incident that leaves them with a vulnerability to specific damage types. A remedy exists in the town of Portland. But they’ll need to quest to get it.

A Two-Hour Adventure for Tier 2 Characters. Optimized for APL 8.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: Apocalypse Gnoll
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The players travel to the Shadow Marches to help fight of an insurgency of gnolls.

boardgame.name: Jurassic Ark
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The third installment of the Tales of the Dark Lanterns series has the players facing off against velociraptors that are airdropped into Sharn. They investigate a local crime syndicate and end up going on an adventure to the Talenta Plains.

boardgame.name: Undead Dawn
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In this sequel to The Gain of Thrones, the Dark Lanterns are sent to New Cyre to monitor the situation there. A riot breaks out and a comrade is assassinated. Through investigating they find out about a dangerous plot against the king.

boardgame.name: The Gain of Thrones
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Dark Lanterns are the covert agency of Breland's military. In the first adventure of this campaign, the Lanterns investigate the assassination of Breland's most famous general and it leads them to a rebel faction within Thrane.

boardgame.name: Shadefall Crypt
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Grey Pox ended over fifty years ago, leaving in its wake a devastation unlike anything the Torrian Empire had ever witnessed. Four out of every five people perished from the withering, wasting death of the plague. Now, every city and town, no matter how glorious its past, is an island of civilization, isolated from the caravans and river barges that once brought prosperity and wealth to the people of the old Empire.

Shadefall is one such town—a walled city, slowly crumbling, as bandits, monsters, and the ever-darkening Whisperwood forest creep closer every day. Most of the people of this town have never been more than a few miles from its deteriorating walls, scratching out a living using old, rusty tools of the former empire.

It is under these conditions that characters start their adventure. Citizens of the town of Shadefall, the adventurers discover a book which details the location of an old crypt in the town’s run-down East Ward. During the Grey Pox, a necromancer used the crypt for bizarre experiments. Now, that area of town is rapidly deteriorating, and soon this crypt may be exposed to the streets above. What threats lie in the old ruins? What treasures? The characters will soon find out.

boardgame.name: The Catacombs
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Standing before the entrance to the catacombs under the city, you wonder if the legends are true about a hidden treasure in the vaults below. A staircase heads down into the darkness where a new adventure waits.

A 2-3 hour adventure for groups of 3rd level characters. Play as a one-shot or drop into your homebrew campaign. This adventure has been playtested in both scenarios.

boardgame.name: Koboldgold
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

„Da steht ihr nun. Vor euch liegen die Überreste eures Gottes. Seine gewaltigen Schwingen sind zerbrochen und zerschnitten. Ein schwarzer See aus Blut bedeckt den Boden des Tempels.

Eure Welt ist zu Ende! Euer Gott besiegt! Sein Tempel geplündert und seine Leiche geschändet!

Aber ihr wärt keine Kobolde, wenn nicht Hunger und Gier euer Denken übernehmen würden.
Und so fällt euch nach einer Mahlzeit (es gab Drachengott) ein, dass der Blaue Gott seine Schätze ja nicht hier gelagert hat. Er hat sie irgendwohin gebracht.“

boardgame.name: The Sea Eternal
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Imazel was a local hero, a legend. She stood up to a Deep Scion named Amnon. Imazel drove him and his crew off and saved the town. Years later Amnon got his revenge by kidnapping Imazel. She now suffers somewhere at the bottom of the sea. What depths will you go to save her?

boardgame.name: The Leylands
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Welcome to The Leylands! Here the leylines of the world demarcate the intersection of the material and immaterial planes. Occasionally, the world's magical essence overflows at this intersection leaving behind a dangerous and powerful form of crystallized magic called leystone, which defines the culture and landscape for miles in any direction.

boardgame.name: Fog Over Barovia
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

"Enough time for one more story. One more story, before dawn, just to keep us warm."

Fog Over Barovia is a ghostly adventure for Curse of Strahd inspired by John Carpenter's classic nautical horror film, The Fog. The adventure is set in a new Barovian village, Antonbucher, a lakeside fishing village opposite Vallaki. It is designed for three tiers of challenge covering PCs of level 1-6, to be played in 1-2 sessions.

Can your PCs save the people of Antonbucher from the terrible curse of the lake, and their own past?

boardgame.name: Barovian Boogeyman
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

“Tonight, He Comes Home.”

The PCs assist the Martikovs in delivering wine to Krezk for the Harvest Eve festival. On the road, they draw the attention of the Shape, the terrible agent of the gods of slaughter and death. Will they survive?

You Can’t Kill the Boogeyman is a Curse of Strahd adventure for PCs level 6-8 inspired by John Carpenter’s 1978 horror masterpiece, “Halloween.” This product also expands the horror potential with “Haddlefeld,” a Ravenloft domain of dread inspired by the “Halloween” franchise, with a surprising Darklord.

boardgame.name: The Hidden Stronghold
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A low level adventure for 5e Dungeons and Dragons that harkens back to the early days of the game. Suitable for fledgling characters but contains advice for modifying encounters for more experienced low-level characters. Contains 43 printer-friendly pages (no art), including maps of two dungeon levels, 3 new monsters, and details for a small campaign-neutral settlement from which to begin play. Fully-detailed encounter sections designed to keep DM preparation to a minimum.

Plot Summary: A party of adventurers is contracted to escort the rogue Dunkel through a seemingly peaceful stretch of forest. What could go wrong? The chance discovery of a network of caverns leads the group to the dungeon level of a kobold stronghold and greater peril than they possibly could have imagined.

boardgame.name: Courage
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Wake up!

The Beast is back, devouring hope wherever it goes.

We need the Hero of Courage to save us once more…

Courage is a solo RPG using the Carta System to create a dungeon-crawling experience inspired by games from “The Legend Of Zelda” series. You’ll play as the recently awoken Hero of Courage, exploring Dungeons and gathering power for your final confrontation against evil incarnate.

boardgame.name: The Smiling City
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A new adventure awaits you with exclusive monsters, magic items, a new Amalgamation lineage, and two exclusive 3D-animated maps!

In the distance, you see the glistening sight of Wonder, a city known for being riddled with crime and violence. But as you arrive, everything is different. You only see a sprawling, gorgeous city with white marble walls, pavemented streets lined with great palm trees; the townsfolk are well-dressed, well-mannered people walking around doing their daily business. And everyone has a chilling, unending smile on their faces.

Discover the secrets of this city in this adventure! Compatible with any setting, easy to integrate into your campaign, and also perfect for a one shot session with your party.

boardgame.name: Gravecard
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You are an urban explorer.

A creepy one.

There's nothing you love more in the world than wandering through graveyards, enjoying the tranquility and silence that such a place can provide. But it also stimulates your imagination. You are aware that every grave tells a story.

And you are here to tell us about them.

boardgame.name: Fanaberia
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

O, a to wygląda, jakby ktoś podzielił fabularne przez zero. Jaką to ma wartość? ....przybliżoną. Surowe mięsiwo, bez cięć i głaskania. Żywioł bałagan. Stworzone do pokazywania palcem. Czej, to ten typ spod łóżka, którego chcieli zamieść pod dywan!

WYŁĄCZNY PATRONAT MEDIALNY: F-PEN.PL

boardgame.name: Strzygi
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Wights is an RPG about revenge from beyond the grave.

The characters

In the game, players assume the roles of Wights — people who came back to life to punish their killers. Wights are beautiful, dangerous, but most of all they’re bloodthirsty. They embody edgy antiheroes popular in the media at the end of the 20th century. Expect leather coats, guns, katanas, and sunglasses worn even in complete darkness. In this world, sex and violence are answers to all the questions.

The setting

Wights seek their Nemeses in the world of dark, dangerous, and overly edgy sprawling cities, as they were presented in the famous 1990s action movies and comic books. Violence, corruption, and treachery are everywhere and the endings are usually bloody, not happy.

The Rules

The game rules are based on Lasers & Feelings. They're brief, simple, and story-oriented and support improvisation and encourage all participants to create a bloody and dynamic story, full of exciting details and unexpected twists. The game was designed for short, action-packed game sessions played without any prep work.

boardgame.name: /dia
boardgame.description: /dia is a micro ttrpg that invites the player to create a character and then imagine a moment of impending doom. The player then decides what comes next.

boardgame.name: Purgatorio
boardgame.description:
After leaving Hell, L. enters Purgatory and finds it being consumed by shadows. Using the energy of her soul, she tries to fight off the darkness, but it may just be enough to shine the path and escape. You will take on the role of L. to save her from being consumed...lost...forgotten...

Purgatorio is a beautiful solo game inspired by Dante's journey in the Divine Comedy. In this game, you will manage L.'s soul's energy and try to light the forest up. Her energy is greatly limited, so you must figure out a way to recycle it as much as you need. The darkness will come, and it will reduce her energy to zero, so be quick...but clever.

During a turn, you will use up to two Energy cards and resolve the effect depending on the combination and placement of those cards; these effects are revealing and/or moving through Purgatory tiles, storing and restoring Energy (cards), and dealing with the Shadows (cards). Your objective is to reveal 18 tiles before you lose all your energy or lose 8 tiles to the shadows. The Shadow cards will be cycling in and out of your deck depleting your cards and the tiles.

boardgame.name: Dredge
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Dredge is an exploration-based journaling game about sailing through an enormous lake known as the Wringwaste, hauling up mysterious items from its depths as you go, while struggling to regain the memories you've lost.

Throughout the course of the game, you will unearth a plethora of odd items, evade a malevolent denizen of the deep, and reveal a great mystery about the Wringwaste itself.

Dredge is written to be a solo experience, but the game can be played by multiple people taking on the role of the boat's cramped crew.

boardgame.name: Partyzant
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Minidodatek do gry fabularnej Podmieńcy. Kiedy postać gracza powinna zostać porwana przez Dziki Gon i zakończyć grę, niniejsze zasady pozwalają grać dalej, stając się złym partyzantem, którego ściga Dziki Gon.

boardgame.name: Dwory Końca Miasta
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Zbiór ośmiu dodatkowych dworów wróżek do wykorzystania w czasie gry w Podmieńców:

- Beboki
- Fomorianie
- Jednorożce
- Kyubi
- Leprechauny
- Płanetnicy
- Trytony
- Yeti

boardgame.name: Barter
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Minidodatek do gry fabularnej Podmieńcy: Magia i Brud, pozwalający postaciom graczy sprzedawać marzenia i wspomnienia w zamian za ogień z nieba i skrzydlate rumaki.

boardgame.name: Kvad
boardgame.description:
User summary:

The core rulebook for the Norwegian Viking-insipred role-playing game Kvad.

boardgame.name: Follow Me In The Night; A Cursed Radio
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

You wake up. You can’t remember when you slept but it’s night now. You peak out through venetian blinds, careful to avoid giving too much indication of being alive. Your ghosts are still outside. You’ve been haunted for a while now. The ghosts are clinging close to your soul, picking over scabs, asking if you’ve forgotten.

You turn on the radio; it’s resting on an unused signal. But you start to hear music. Music that reminds me of your ghosts. You try and dial another frequency in. The song persists. You step outside. The wind whistles the music you want to leave behind me. The cursed radio follows in your foot steps.

Maybe you can find banishing spells on the street. Tap into the music and magic coursing through your veins. Visit your old haunts. See if you can leave your curse behind.

Follow Me in the Night; a Cursed Radio is a Carta journaling game inspired by film noir movies, Phonogram by Kieron Gillen and Jamie McKelvie, and many sleepless nights. You play a weary magic user, wandering dark streets banishing the phantoms that haunt them; phantoms powered by bad memories and cursed music.

boardgame.name: Referee's Screen
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Four panel screen, illustrated on the outside, and with a variety of tables and summaries on the inside, such as:


Colonies Summary
Universal Planetary Profile and Universal Colony Profile keys
Orbital Distances
Effective World Size Modifiers
Burn Requirements
Time to Orbit
Action Summary
Effect Results Table
Characteristic Modifiers
Encounter Distance
Encounter Range Bands
Sensor Time-lag
Range Bands
Crew Actions
The Firing Solution
Spacecraft Critical Hits Location
Ranged Attack Modifiers
Cover Bonuses
Starship Combat Range Modifiers

boardgame.name: Ynaros Fallin'
boardgame.description:
Welcome to Ynaros Fallin’! The world-shattering game of Shaman-on-Shaman dueling! Navigate through wild Lands and harness their power to increase your magical might. Meet the other Shaman and prove your mastery. Do you have what it takes to become the wisest Shaman the Land has ever seen?

Each turn has up to 4 phases: Deeds, Fate, Cantrips, Fatigue.

In the first phase, a player can play 2 actions from the following:
a) Draw 5 cards from the common pile
b) Play cards from their hand
c) Use the personal die to move miniatures
d) Sacrifice a magic stone to perform a control on one of the opponent's characters

In the second phase (optional) takes place as a consequence of the characters move.
In the third phase (optional) player can sacrifice magic stones to get experience points and get Boons from Red Magic Land(s) under their control.
The final phase decreases the energy value of the personal die of the active player.

The game ends if one of the following conditions take place :
a) A player completes their 6 spaces for magic land in their personal board.
b) 3 magic land piles are depleted.
c) A player loses all their vital stones.
d) A player loses all their characters.

A player win when :
a) Has the highest amount of experience points (if the ends with A or B end game conditions).
b) The opponent lost all their vital stones.
c) The opponent lost all their characters.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Mystery Party in the Box: Bajo la Luna Azul
boardgame.description:
In this deductive genre, each player plays the role of a character with the dual purpose of solving a mystery and simultaneously achieving their own goals. The investigation, the negotiations with the rest of the cast and the exchange of information are essential pieces to solve the crime, but do not forget that the murderer is one of you. You can't believe everything they tell you, but you can't take victory without trusting someone either...

Italy, 1962. The head of a local mafia family is murdered in his mansion shortly before he is rumored to announce his successor. Next to the corpse, there is only a handcuffed man. The movements of the victim's little brother and wife, as well as those of the men in the family, the fortune teller who works for the house and the prostitute who frequents the mansion intertwine over and over again until weaving a dense tapestry that hides the truth.

boardgame.name: Bankrut
boardgame.description: Polish version of Monopoly released at the turn of the 70's and 80's. It differs from the original in that you can take profits from your territories while sitting in prison.

boardgame.name: I Know My God
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

What do you do when you find yourself growing into the version of you that you want to be? What do you do when that version of you contradicts everything you've ever been taught to believe?

In this game, you'll tell the story of THE KID, the protagonist of a 44-episode claymation christian educational children's series, as they discover the fact that they are queer. You will document the adventure of the THE KID and THE PET, as they navigate the strange crossroads of belief and bigotry in their extremely religious little town.

boardgame.name: Knight Astray
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

You are a knight. You have been stripped of your titles and banished from your holdings. You now live in a hovel in the countryside. Your hovel is near a small village. The village is regularly troubled by problems and, being a former champion, you feel compelled to help them.

Knight Astray is an 9 page solo trpg with journaling, upgrades, branching plotlines, dice crunch, and possible valor.

boardgame.name: Sinful Meatcage
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Deity or demon - once you were a mighty superhuman force. Until you angered the sorceress Nis. She imprisoned you in a human body using a dangerous dark ritual, and stripped you of all your powers. Mortality is a new concept for you: when your skin prison dies, your spirit remains trapped inside it and - fully conscious - experiences the body painfully decaying.

Sinful Meatcage is a character class for Mörk Borg.

boardgame.name: Cards Against Muggles
boardgame.description: This is a Harry Potter-themed Cards Against Humanity clone. Follows the standard Cards Against Humanity rules.

boardgame.name: Cards Against Marvel
boardgame.description: This is a Marvel-themed Cards Against Humanity clone. Follows the standard Cards Against Humanity rules.

boardgame.name: Ork The Casbah
boardgame.description:
This game was attached to the ioGioco 18 magazine.

Finally the Ork Pistols concert tonight! In the Casbah, the coolest rock cave of the Desolate Lands, the punk-ork clans are ready to throw themselves under the concert stage in a frenzied Pogo, by dint of jumps, chases and shoves.
Will you be able to make your clan conquer the best places and keep its members as united as possible, according to the motto of “If the kids are united… then we'll never be divided”?
The evening promises to be very, very… eventful!

In this game, the results of the dice are used to make the members of our rocker orc clan reach the best positions. And eventually to displace rival orcs.
There are two sets of dice. One represents the entry queue. The other set, called "the reserve", is used to choose which die to take from the queue and use for our placement. Then rearrange the queue with the die taken from the reserve.
If you don't have 6 pairs of dice of the same color, there are tiles and rules in the magazine for using only 6 dice.

boardgame.name: Fino a prova contraria: omicidio color zaffiro
boardgame.description:
This game was attached to the ioGioco #21 magazine.

You are late. Damn if you're late! The Judge will not take it well. But it's not your fault, really! Your colleague, Turk, the one following the case, had a kind of nervous breakdown and left the office suddenly. Now you are here running up the courthouse stairs, dodging the crowds and desperately scrolling through the papers of the first hearing. Because there has already been a first hearing but you haven't read all the papers yet ... and you have to face a murder trial!

Fino a Prova Contraria is a new cooperative game system that can also be played solo.
As a lawyer, the game will see you face a sequence of accusations: in each of them the Attorney will try to prove the guilt of your client. The focal point of each intervention will be highlighted in bold: to it, you will have to respond with a Defense among those available to you, or using evidence or testimony that contradicts the statements of the Prosecutor.
As you try to draft a defense, you will discover more and more details that will allow you to investigate the murder that took place.
The title of this first chapter is Omicidio color zaffiro.

boardgame.name: Domesday, The Norman Conquest 1066-1106
boardgame.description:
King William…reigned over England, and by his capacity so thoroughly surveyed it, that there was not a hide of land in England that he wist not who had it, or what it was worth, and afterwards set it down in his book. The land of the Britons was in his power, and he wrought castles therein…and extorted from his subjects many marks of gold, and many hundred pounds of silver, which he took of his people, for little need, by right and by unright.

Anglo-Saxon Chronicle, 1087

King Edward the Confessor of England did not prepare well for his death, to avoid trouble he promised his kingdom to King Magnus Olafsson of Norway (a claim inherited by Harald Hardrada), King Sweyn Estridsson of Denmark, Duke William of Normandy, and Earl Harold Godwinson of Wessex. When Edward died on the fifth day of January 1066 these four powerful warlords raised armies to back their claims by force. William the Conqueror won the crown but had to defend his new kingdom from fresh invasions and rebellious barons. To formalise his control of the kingdom after twenty years of conquest he ordered a Great Survey in 1085, a record so final and unalterable that it was named Domesday.

Domesday is a card driven game depicting the Norman Conquest of England from 1066 to 1106. The players control Normans, Barons, English, Danes, Norse, Scots, Welsh, and Irish, playing cards to resolve Events or use Marks to activate their units. Players win by earning the most victory points through controlling, contesting, or plundering areas, building cathedrals and towers, and making their leader the King of England.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Alice Cooper's HorrorBox
boardgame.description: This game is in the style of Cards Against Humanity with added Dare cards.

boardgame.name: Top Dogs
boardgame.description:
Tricks win the treats in this barking good strategy card game Top Dogs from Ridley's Games. Are you the prized pooch that will win the most treats?

You and your fellow hounds have two rounds to win after starting off with nine trick cards for nine chances to win the most treats and be the ultimutt Top Dog.

Each trick and treat card has a points value, and players must choose which trick cards to play to score the most highly prized treats. Can playing fetch win the treat of a good head scratch? Or can a balancing act land some tasty sausages? Sniff out the 'Top Dog' card which will trump all the other tricks! Will you be top dog or sent to the doghouse?

Pawfect for friends and family fun, Top Dogs includes 95 game cards and instructions. Ages 6+. 2 to 5 players. Average 15 minute gameplay. Printed on FSC paper and with vegetable inks.

Fancy some feline fun? Try our other game in the series, Fat Cats!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Rome, LLC.: From Heraclius to Manzikert
boardgame.description:
Rome, LLC. is a game of the Eastern Byzantine Empire and Western Frankish Empire from the unification of the Frankish Kingdom by King Chlothar II in 613 CE. to the disastrous defeat of Emperor Romanos IV to the Seljuk Turks at Manzikert in 1071 CE, which precipitated the Crusades.
Heraclius overthrew the Emperor Phocas in 610 CE, but his prolonged war with Persia weakened the Byzantine Empire, which almost collapsed to the might of Islam and the invading Avars, Bulgars, and Slavs. The Empire survived thanks to the Theodosian Walls of Constantinople, the secret of Greek Fire, and capable leaders such as John Kurkuas, John Tzimiskes, and Basil the Bulgar-Killer, who reconquered territory lost to the barbarians.

King Chlothar II united the Frankish Kingdom in 613 CE, but his inept successors were replaced by the warlord Charles Martell, who repelled the Islamic Invasion at Tours in 732 CE. His grandson Charlemagne invaded Germany, Spain, and Italy and in 800 CE was crowned Emperor by Pope Leo III, reviving the Western Roman Empire. Like its predecessor the Frankish Empire slowly fell apart, divided by civil war, and devastated by Norse and Magyar raiders. The last Carolingian ruler died in 987 CE and the empire split into warring kingdoms.

Two players may play Rome, LLC. one controlling the Eastern Byzantine Empire and the other the Western Frankish Empire. The Byzantines have the larger, wealthier, empire, but their enemies are more dangerous. The weaker economy of the Franks makes them more dependent on allies and marcher lords to guard the frontier and must expand their kingdom into an empire. Each plays their own game side-by-side, with their own statesmen and units, co-operating against invading Arabs, Avars, Bulgars, Magyars, Moors, Norse, Rus, Saxons, Seljuks, and Slavs. The game may be played solitaire, with the player either controlling one empire, or both at the same time.

Each empire has its own statesmen who are made emperors, kings, governors, or rebels. They are rated for their military, administration, religion, and intrigue abilities, and each has a special ability. St Boniface reformed the Frankish Church and the evangelist of Germany, so is a Western Statesman with 1 Military ability, 4 Administration ability, 5 Religious ability, 2 Intrigue ability, and the Convert special ability.

The map has provinces grouped into commands with their own governors, who collects taxes, quells insurgents, fights wars, but may assassinate their emperor or rebel and start a civil war. Emperors counters are used to change commands and rules and determine which statesmen of the new dynasty will become emperor, regardless of their abilities (or lack thereof).
Cavalry, Guards, Auxilia, Forts, and Fleets are used to fight wars and garrison provinces, with some provinces held by allies or marcher lords to protect the frontier from barbarians. Enemy leaders and wars move from province to province until defeated, encouraging revolts, and shrink the empires. Fighting a war may result in a triumph, which removes the war, increases prestige, reduces unrest, generates gold, and annexes provinces, but may also lead to a disaster or bloody stalemate.

Victory is determined by winning Prestige, which is earned by imperial administration, annexing provinces, defeating wars, and financing prestige projects. The loss of both Constantinople and Rome to the barbarians results in defeat, but bankruptcy and unrest can also drive an empire to destruction.

Rome, LLC. uses the system from Rome, Inc. (ATO 53). Each turn represents 5-10 years, with 10 turns in each scenario. The five scenarios start in 610 CE, 711 CE, 814 CE, 888 CE, and 973 CE which may be combined into campaign games. Players may continue the scenarios from Rome, Inc. and Rome, IInc. into Rome, LLC. allowing them to play 17 consecutive scenarios covering 1500 years of history.

—description from the designer
boardgame.boardgameintegration: Rome, GP.: From Camillus to Augustus
Rome, IInc.: From Diocletian to Heraclius
Rome, Inc.: From Augustus to Diocletian
Rome, GP.: From Camillus to Augustus
Rome, IInc.: From Diocletian to Heraclius
Rome, Inc.: From Augustus to Diocletian

boardgame.name: La Bête: A Solo Game
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

"They say you are a monster. Navigate the world and manage your resources carefully to escape the forces pursuing you, or meet them head-on to destroy them and reclaim your territory."

La Bête is an experimental fantasy game created with the Carta SRD for the Carta Jam. It is a modified system that combines the original survival mode and collection modes of gameplay for a longer solo game about managing your resources to survive and either escape or fight.

boardgame.name: El último hombre
boardgame.description:
Card and chip game in which a command of soldiers or partisans work together to face a mission. On their way to the target they must overcome different dangers in the form of soldiers, tanks, etc.

Juego de cartas y fichas en las que un comando de soldados o partisanos trabajan juntos para afrontar una misión. En su camino hacia el objetivo deben superar distintos peligros en forma de soldados, tanques, etc.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Last Stop
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Last Stop is solo journaling game about the glimpses of scenery from a train window.

The game uses a deck of cards to provide writing prompts, offering fleeting images of the mysterious world on the other side of the glass as you travel to your destination, the last stop on the line.

boardgame.name: Funky Fungi
boardgame.description:
See if you have what it takes to be the mushroom master in Funky Fungi from Ridley's Games! In this card-collecting game that will definitely grow on you, forage for the best fungi to be the first player to reach ten points and win the game.

The starting player chooses a mushroom card from their hand to start the round, and the other players must play a card matching the color of this card with a higher or lower value. The card with the highest value of the lead color wins the round, with the winning player getting first pick of one of the cards played that round, the second player then choosing one, and so on. As the game goes on, the aim is to try to collect clusters, or combinations of 2 to 4 different fungi. Each completed cluster has a points value, and the player who reaches ten points first will be crowned champignon!

Be sure to pick your fungi wisely, as some can be toxic and played against other foragers!

A magical mushroom game for fun-gis and fun-girls alike, it's suitable for ages 8+, 2 to 4 players and has an average 30 minute gameplay. Packaged in a travel-friendly, mushroom-style box, this game is super portabella! Printed on FSC paper and with vegetable inks.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Can You Dig It?
boardgame.description:
There's never a dill moment in this absolutely radishing game of Can You Dig It? from Ridley's Games!

In this fast-paced card game, gardeners use trowel and error to harvest fruit and veg from the 4 community plots to develop the most impressive feast by the end of the game.

Cultivate sets of the varieties of fruit and veg cards that are thriving in the garden with the ultimate aim to collect the ingredients needed to make as many of the four recipes (salad, sauce, soup, and stew) as you can to win the most points!

But watch out for roaming chickens -- players can play a chicken card to steal a harvested vegetable from a fellow gardener!

Perfect for plant and gardening lovers, this game is suitable for ages 8+, 2 to 4 players, and has an average 20 minute gameplay.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Dockfighters: The Ale Wars
boardgame.description:
A Miniature Aerial Combat Game with Epic Dieselpunk Fighteraircrafts, Airships and airborne launched Dockfighters, set in 1948.
You move your fighteraircrafts on a hex grid in different heights and with different speeds.
Planes can be equipped with various weapons and your pilots will gather experience during each combat.
You play against or together with friends, in single missions or entire campaigns.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Savant
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Savant is a new class for the Center Space or other 3.x based games. Savants are technological experts that specialize in some form of technology or science. They use their expertise to power-up weapons and gear, make inventions on the fly, and more.

This is the final volume of a four volume series — each presenting new psionically themed classes and races. Volume 4 introduces the Savant class, an updated and expanded version of the Center Space's Engineer class, and one new playable race, and one revised race.

The Savant class. Savants choose one of four specializations:

Computers: experts in hacking computer systems and robots.
Tech: specialists in all types of technology, from tools to weapons to powered armor.
Science: experts in analysis and science, especially chemistry and biology.
Psycrystal: masters of the ancient advanced technology of the Nimahnse.
Two new races: the Nimahnse (hyper-intelligent squid-like creatures) and Aznon (a species of sentient robots)

New equipment: including new and updated weapons, armor, gear, and cybernetics

Expanded and revised hacking and Nim traveling rules

Revised feats and skills

boardgame.name: The Train Between Planes
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

All aboard! There is legend of a phantasmal locomotive that carries itspassengers to-and-from the realms of the living and dead —with all manner of improbably stops in between! Obeying the directives of the Gods of Death themselves, this otherworldly express can signal a one-way trip to the afterlife, or an incorporeal shortcut between indescribable stretches of the world. The Train Between Planes is now boarding.

Who constructed this strange contraption? Where does it lead? This adventure takes your player through a gamut of esoteric locations or encounters that are all up to you! The Train Between Planes also gives you a brand new ruleset for using the Otherworld Express as a fast-travel system for your campaign.

boardgame.name: Wreckage of the Crimson Cove
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the depths of an island cove is the wreckage of a legendary pirate war, the Crimson Cove; named such because all the blood spilled in the conflict was said to stain the basin crimson. These notoriously haunted grounds are said to be rife with the pirates' treasure - though no foolish explorers have ever returned to confirm the legends. Whether hearing of the legends of the Crimson Cove from NPCs, or through a chance encounter with a ghost ship, the players will brave unforetold horrors as they explore the caverns of the Crimson Cove.

boardgame.name: Deep Within The Gibbering Dark
boardgame.description:
From Introduction:

Three solar days ago, an asteroid struck Shapley-K7 in the outer rim of the Belt of Despair. The impact destroyed the surface structures of the Prosser Psychiatric Institute, a medium-security facility for the criminally insane. However, the underground sections of the facility were largely undamaged and are currently running on auxiliary power. In total, nine inmates and three staff members remain alive and trapped below.

Having picked up the institute’s automated distress beacon, the E.S.S. Oslo*, a mostly automated freighter out of Grunthar-X13, has arrived and dispatched a small rescue
team. Having entered the facility through an emergency stairwell, the rescue team made their way down. The damaged
stairs gave way near the bottom, and the Legionnaires fell approximately 20 feet before landing at the bottom. The team regained consciousness relatively unscathed, only to find no way of climbing back up.

boardgame.name: Judas
boardgame.description:
From Introduction:

In the days before, when the Earth was still whole, butchers used Judas goats to lead livestock to slaughter. Trained to gain the trust of others, the Judas led herds into the slaughterhouse while Their own life was spared.

This scenario is all about mystery and creeping dread. Tela Station is filled with survivors serving The Grimm, luring others to slaughter in exchange for their own survival. Its personnel attempt to split groups of new arrivals and pick them off one by one. There are great rewards here, from a rich stash of supplies to the possibility of finding the location of the Gate of Infinite Stars. but the legion can’t make use of them unless they identify the threat these Judas survivors pose, make allies and escape. They may sabotage or destroy the station to prevent others from falling into its trap, or maybe they overthrow its inhabitants only to become new Judases themselves.

boardgame.name: As Long As The Grass Grows
boardgame.description:
Your Father has provided a country large enough for all of you, and he advises you to remove to it. There your white brothers will not trouble you; they will have no claim to the land, and you can live upon it, you and all your children, as long as the grass grows or the water runs, in peace and plenty. It will be yours forever.

President Andrew Jackson

AS LONG AS THE GRASS GROWS is a board game that adapts the COIN Series developed by GMT Games to the Conquest of the American West from 1845-1881. Players use Events, Commands and Special Abilities to place and move pieces on the map to achieve victory. The players take the roles of four Factions; the Great Plains Tribal Faction (GP) consisting of the Comanche and their Kiowa allies; and the Dakota, Lakota, Yankton, and Yanktonai Sioux with their Arapaho, Blackfoot, Cheyenne, and Cree allies. The Northwestern Tribal Faction (NW) has the Chinook, Modoc, Nez Perce, Rogues, Umatilla, Yakima of the Pacific Northwest; the Yaqui of Mexico; the Navajo enemies of the Apaches; and the Crow, Flathead, and Pawnee enemies of the Sioux. The Southwestern Tribal Faction (SW) has the Chiricahua, Lipan, Mescalero and Western Apaches, their Mojave and Yuma allies, and the Bannock, Paiute, Shoshone, and Ute Tribes of the Great Basin. The United States Faction (US) includes the federal, state and territorial governments; the US Army; and militia, miners, pioneers, settlers, buffalo hunters, and railroad companies.

Cards are drawn from the deck one at time, with one card in play and the following card face up on top of the deck. Each Event card shows the order in which Eligible Factions may choose to resolve the Event or one of their own Commands, sometimes with one of their Special Abilities. Resolving an Event or Command makes the Faction Ineligible for the next card. President Events interrupt play as the Factions determine victory, collect revenue, pay upkeep, make treaties, and relocate pieces.

—description from the designer
boardgame.boardgameimplementation: As Long as the Grass Grows: The Conquest of the American West 1845-1881

boardgame.name: Judgement of the Six
boardgame.description:
From Introduction:

Great news! Your legion lives another day having completed
another successful endeavor.

The bad news? Your supplies run dangerously low, the ship desperately needs dockside patching and YOUR LEGION itself could definitely use some well-deserved shore leave, for whatever R&R is worth in the ‘verse.

For a change, things are going your way. Systems identify X-11 as an open colony nearby, one capable of meeting all your needs, more or less. The colony resides on a large mineral-rich
asteroid where colonists mine for precious metals.
